__data__.text: Skill gem (known as Active Skill Gems in item filter), is an item class which grants skills to the player by placing them into an item socket. Similar to support gems, skill gems can gain experience and level up increasing both their Attribute(s) and character level requirement as well as the effect of the stats granted by the skill. Skill gems can be further augmented by placing appropriate support gems into a linked socket. Skill gems have gem tags which are used to categorize them, but note that gem tags are not intended to indicate whether a skill gem can be supported by other gems[1] or whether specific stats (or modifiers)[2] apply. While support gems are referred to as "support gems" by passive skills and item mods, such as Catarina's +# to Level of Socketed Support Gems, item filters refer to them as Support Skill Gems.

Transfigured skill gems are alternate versions of existing skill gems, denoted by having "of X" as a suffix that alters its function and balance. While they are technically the same item as their default versions, they can often drastically change the identity of the skill, even changing its gem tags and mechanics. The transfigured gem system, introduced in 3.23, replaced three older systems [1] that enhanced or altered the effects of skills: alternate quality gems, labyrinth helmet enchantments, and unique threshold jewels. It also took, or took inspiration, from prior league systems, such as 3.21's Crucible Passive Tree notables. Transfigured gems that have been corrupted to grant a Vaal skill will provide the transfigured base skill and Vaal skill. Vaal versions of skills do not have transfigurations.[2] Trigger cooldowns are shared between multiple skills of the same type, including any transfigurations. Skill microtransactions are compatible with their respective transfigured versions.[3] Within stash tabs, transfigured gems can be searched by searching for "transfigured" or any set of characters composing the word, including "trans" or "sfi". Using the Divine Font at the end of the Labyrinth allows players to obtain transfigured gems with varying degrees of randomness. There are 185 transfigured skill gems.

Absolution is a skill that damages enemies in an area, applying a debuff for a short duration. If a non-unique enemy dies while affected by the debuff, the enemy's corpse will be consumed to summon a friendly Sentinel of Absolution minion for a longer secondary duration, or to refresh the duration and life of an existing one instead if you have the maximum number of them. A Sentinel of Absolution, according to the datamined material, is a reskinned Temple Adjudicator (which itself has another variant Heretical Adjudicator).[1] Absolution can drop anywhere. Note that helmet enchantments are no longer obtainable since version 3.23.0 and can only be obtained in permanent leagues as already enchanted items from before this patch. Alchemist's Mark is a spell that marks a single target with a curse. Hits against the marked target grant flask charges and when you ignite or poison the marked enemy, it leaves behind burning ground or caustic ground under them, respectively. Elemental Proliferation: Ignites that are proliferated from a nearby enemy or corpse to the marked target will not trigger the burning ground. Flask charges: Gain 1 Flask Charge when you Hit a Cursed Enemy grants charges to all flasks.[1] Proxies: hits from proxies, such as totems or traps, are unable to create this curse's ground effects. The duration of the burning and caustic ground are independent of the duration of the ignite or poison that applied it, making it work well with builds that use high-damage, low-duration ignite/poisons. Alchemist's Mark can drop anywhere. Ambush can drop anywhere. Ancestral Cry is a warcry skill that taunts nearby enemies and grants a buff to you and nearby allies. The buff grants additional elemental resistances and maximum elemental resistances based on the power of nearby enemies. It also causes your next strike attacks to exert, targeting two additional enemies. This article describes historical game content. In Version 3.25.0, melee totems have been removed from the game. Ancestral Protector is a totem skill that creates an Ancestor Totem which will attack enemies with melee strikes while the player stands close to it. Being near it increases the player's attack speed. Ancestral Protector is drop disabled. Resistances: The following helmet enchantments affect Ancestral Protector. Note that helmet enchantments are no longer obtainable since version 3.23.0 and can only be obtained in permanent leagues as already enchanted items from before this patch.

This article describes historical game content. In Version 3.25.0, melee totems have been removed from the game. Ancestral Warchief is a skill that creates an Ancestor Totem which will attack enemies with melee AoE slams while the character stands close to it. Being near it also increases the character's damage. Ancestral Warchief has an attack speed multiplier of 90%. Ancestral Warchief is drop disabled. Anger is an aura skill that adds fire damage to the attacks and spells of the caster and their allies. See the aura page for more details. The aura area of effect radius of a level 1 Anger is 3.6 metre. The area of effect scales with gem level and quality, as well as other source of increase/more area of effect modifiers. Anger can drop anywhere. Animate Guardian is a spell, animating weapons and armour on the ground to form an allied minion. Using this skill on an identified item on the ground creates an Animated Guardian that moves and attacks similar to a zombie. Similar to Spectres and unlike other minions, a Guardian stays with you even after logging off and on. If you unequip the skill gem, the Guardian disappears until you equip the gem again, at which point the same Guardian (retaining all its equipment) reappears after casting the spell again. This also holds true when swapping a different AG gem in. Socketing the gem in a weapon or shield slot allows you to recall the Guardian at will by switching weapon sets (default hotkey: X). You can only have one Guardian at a time. It can be equipped with a helmet, body armour, pair of gloves, pair of boots, a shield, and melee weapons. Ranged weapons cannot be animated, similar to Animate WeaponAnimate WeaponDuration, Minion, Spell, PhysicalLevel: (1-20)Cost: (4-16) ManaCast Time: 0.60 secRequires Level 4Animates a Melee Weapon Item or Lingering Blade to fight by your side. Right click to remove from a socket.. Items can be of any rarity, but must be identified and on the ground to be used. Animated items are consumed by the spell and cannot be recovered. Items containing skill gems cannot be animated, so the Guardian cannot use trigger gems. Items that have modifiers like +x to Maximum life or +x% increased Attack Speed, and even corrupted implicits, apply to the Guardian the same way they apply to player characters; so animating magic or rare equipment can potentially give you a very powerful minion. Unique items can also be used, giving guardians powerful abilities not found elsewhere in the game. Be careful when using valuable items—anything you give to your guardian is gone forever. All modifiers on the items themselves apply to the Animated Guardian once animated, including enchantments, corrupted implicit modifiers, Scourge modifiers, and Crucible passive trees (except modifiers which allocate player notable passive skills, as minions do not have access to your passive tree). The Guardian uses weapons and shields in the same way as player characters, and can dual wield if two one-handed weapons are animated. If you animate an item type that the Guardian is already using (such as a helmet), the new item will overwrite the old one. Equipping an armour piece restores 25% of its life; equipping one-handed weapons or shields will alternate between left and right hand. You cannot equip two shields. The Guardian does not share your max amount of curses you can apply to enemies, and therefore functions as a player with the default curse limit when applying curses (through corrupted gloves, for example). Items: The Guardian's items are tied to the character that summoned it, rather than the gem itself. The gem can freely be changed around without risking loss of the Animate Guardian's equipment. Note that the skill's gem level determines the maximum level requirement of items the Animate Guardian can equip; if the gem's level is too low for an equipped item, it will disable the item temporarily until it is high enough gem level. This does not delete the equipped item. Necromantic Aegis: While using Necromantic Aegis your Guardian benefits from its own shield as well as the one you have equipped, allowing it to gain the benefit of two shields at once. Some unique shields can be quite powerful when doubled up this way.[1] Player versus Player: Animated Guardians killed in PvP areas will not lose their items. This does not apply to Hall of GrandmastersHall of GrandmastersPromenade MapMap Level: 73Map Tier: 6Guild Character: ÙContains the Immortalised GrandmastersPvP damage scaling in effectThe grandest and greatest ever to fight,Divine the champions stand tall.But match their power, best their might,And even the immortal may fall.Travel to this Map by using it in a personal Map Device. Maps can only be used once., even though the map says "PvP damage scaling in effect". In fact, not only is it possible to lose the Guardian's items here, but death is very likely because of the way PvP damage scaling works. Minor enemies can instantly kill a Guardian with 50000+ life in this map, so it is highly recommended to despawn your Guardian before attempting. Item-Granted Skills: Animated Guardians cannot use skills granted by items. Equipping items like Death's Oath, The Rippling Thoughts, or Bubonic Trail will not allow the Guardian to use their associated triggered skills. Equipping items like Tombfist or Bubonic Trail with abyss jewel(s) socketed will not grant their modifiers to a Guardian. This section needs cleanup to meet quality standards. Life regeneration and percentage increases to life are especially potent on an Animated Guardian because of its huge innate life pool. Resistances should also be capped to improve survivability (a Guardian has 40% base elemental resistances and 20% chaos resistance). The stats displayed in the skill's tooltip only accounts for modifiers the skill has, like from the passive tree, jewels, player-equipped items and support gems. It cannot account for further modifiers from things like being affected by an aura, shields through Necromantic Aegis or modifiers from items an Animated Guardian has equipped. These will not factor into the skill's tooltip but are active nonetheless.[2] Note that Kaom's HeartKaom's HeartGlorious PlateArmour: (776-892)Requires Level 68, 191 StrHas no Sockets+1000 to maximum LifeThe warrior whofears will fall. and similar items with +# to maximum Life are of less benefit due to Animated Guardian's very high inherent Life.

Animate Weapon is a spell that animates a weapon on the ground as a flying allied minion. Animate Weapon can be used on identified melee weapons lying on the ground. Bows and Wands cannot be animated unless the threshold jewel Spirit GuardsSpirit GuardsViridian JewelLimited to: 1Radius: MediumMinions deal (8-12)% increased DamageWith at least 40 Dexterity in Radius, Animate Weapon can Animate up to 20 Ranged WeaponsLong after the Karui passed through, the whispers of those who stood their ground at Lioneye's Watch could be heard amongst the rubble.Place into an allocated Jewel Socket on the Passive Skill Tree. Right click to remove from the Socket. is being used. Animated weapons are permanently consumed and cannot be recovered. If the "Key Pickup" option is enabled in the UI tab of the Options menu, the "Highlight items and objects" key may be held in order to animate specific weapons. Otherwise, the skill will attempt to animate a random valid weapon within a small area around the player's cursor. Attempting to animate a weapon with a level requirement higher than the maximum listed on the gem will cost mana and perform the cast animation, but will fail to create a minion. Right click to remove from a socket., but not affected by any of the player's passive tree for specific weapons. All modifiers on the weapon item itself apply to the minions once animated, including enchantments, corrupted implicit modifiers, Scourge modifiers, and Crucible passive trees (except modifiers which allocate player notable passive skills, as minions do not have access to your passive tree). There are different calculations for weapons summoned from items on the ground and lingering blades from spells. Weapons inherit the hit damage, attack speed and critical strike chance of the weapon they are summoned from. This includes any direct modifiers to base stats, such as 108% increased Physical Damage, which are factored into the base damage of the minion. The minion then gains additional Physical damage based on gem level, which is not scaled by weapon local modifiers. The additional damage for Lingering Blades does not apply to animated itemized weapons.

Armageddon Brand is a spell that creates a brand at the target position. While attached, the brands creates fiery meteors that land on the target's location and deal fire damage in an area. Maximum Active Brands: All brands share a limit of three (3) active brand limit. This can be split between the two brand skills (2-1) or all of one type. Passive skills can increase the number of active brands that are allowed to be active at a time. Maximum Brand Attachment: By default, you may only have one brand of any kind attached to a single target at any time. Taking the Keystone Runebinder allows you to place a second brand on a single target. Like the Active Brand limit these brands may either be split (1-1) or both the same type of brand. Spell Echo: Armageddon Brand currently functions with Spell Echo SupportSpell Echo SupportSpell, SupportIcon: kLevel: (1-20)Cost & Reservation Multiplier: 150%Requires Level 38Supports spell skills, making them repeat when cast. The more casting speed multiplier on spell echo does NOT however affect the activation speed of the brand once attached to a target. Meteor: When Armageddon Brand activates, it casts a meteor falling down on the attached enemy. However, this meteor has a slow travel time, so if the enemy is fast-moving, the meteor can miss the enemy entirely. This also affects the "smoothness" of the skill, as this meteor drop delay time cannot be overcome. The meteor deals damage in an area on impact, this area is affected by modifiers to AoE. Ignite: When scaling Ignite, it is not recommended to take Runebinder unless player tries to maximize ignite uptime while using Sadism Support, since having multiple brands attached to an enemy does not increase the Ignite damage taken by the enemy (since there can only be one active Ignite instance on the enemy). The only benefit from the keystone would be higher hit frequency on the enemy which would potentially cause a bigger Ignite (from a bigger hit) to be applied. Armageddon Brand can drop anywhere. Assassin's Mark is a spell that marks a single target with a curse. Hits against the marked target have added critical strike chance and multiplier. The marked target grants a power charge and life and mana recovery when killed. Assassin's Mark can drop anywhere. Assassin's Mark can be created from the following recipes: This item is given as a quest reward for the following quests: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests: No results found The following mods can only be find in legacy item in permanent leagues: The newer version use Assassin's Mark (id: AssassinsMarkTriggered). Note that helmet enchantments are no longer obtainable since version 3.23.0 and can only be obtained in permanent leagues as already enchanted items from before this patch. Some monster also curse the enemies with Assassin's Mark: The skill AvatarAssassinsMarkAura is the aura version that uses by some Harbingers, such as the no.19 Harbinger Harbinger (Assassin's Mark). The aura version of Assassin's Mark has the same visual effect as the player version. The player version was removed from the game since version 3.12.0. Various Daemon monsters are untargetable invisible monsters that act as an agent to apply Mark for various monster modifiers. Enemies afflicted with Assassin's Mark will always grant a power charge and significant amount of life and mana when slain.

Autoexertion is a skill gem that reserves mana for each supported warcry skill to have them trigger automatically once off cooldown. Supported warcries no longer grant buffs or charges, but can still exert attacks and debuff enemies. When linked to Autoexertion, all supported warcries each have a base reservation of 15%. This can be modified by modifiers to reservation efficiency. These modified reservations are then added together, and the sum is used as a single reservation for Autoexertion. This value cannot be further modified, as reservation efficiency is already applied. Autoexertion does not cause warcries to share a cooldown; each warcry will automatically trigger at the end of their cooldowns. Triggering a warcry does not count as 'using' a warcry for when you use a Warcry, but it does count as warcrying for when you Warcry effects (e.g. Lead By Example, gain 5 Valour when you Warcry, if able Banner Mastery), and also as having Warcried Recently (e.g. Admonisher or DeidbellowDeidbellowGilded SalletArmour: (290-397)Evasion: (90-97)Requires Level 33, 38 Str, 38 Dex+(20-30) to Strength+(20-30) to DexterityAdds 10 to 20 Physical Damage to Attacks+(200-300) to Armour20% increased Melee DamageCannot Leech when on Low LifeIf you've Warcried Recently, you and nearby allies have 20% increased Attack, Cast and Movement SpeedMay it echo through the halls.).[1] When warcries are triggered through Autoexertion, each warcry's base mana cost is overwritten to 10 instead of the value on the warcry gem. Autoexertion does not trigger skills in hideouts. Autoexertion can drop anywhere. Autoexertion can be created from the following recipes: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests: The following unique items are related to Autoexertion: No results found

Automation is a hybrid gem. While the Automation skill is active, skills supported by Automation Support trigger immediately and automatically once off cooldown. It supports instant spells without a reservation. It cannot support skills used by totems, traps, or mines. Automation can support multiple instant spells at once. Each skill will be used off cooldown independently. Note that most guard skills and instant movement skills share cooldowns, preventing subsequent linked skills of that category from triggering. Blade Flurry is a channeling melee attack. While channeling, Blade Flurry repeatedly attacks a random enemy in front of the player, also damaging enemies nearby the original target. When released, it will unleash an extra number of attacks equal to the stage reached. BF produces highest dps when player channels to max stages and then releases immediately. Calculations are for the perfect channeling, actual damage will be a bit lower. Calculating ideal dps: For 21 lvl gem : For 21 lvl gem with +1 max stage enchant: Current assumption is that strike calculates damage before updating stage bonus. So fist strike has 0 stage bonus, and n strike has n-1 stage bonus up to max. Release strikes happen after stage bonus has been updated, so they fully benefit from current stage bonus. It is corroborated by Zrevnur's DPS test in the VERY OLD patch. "Blade Flurry vs Reave: 2.86x damage vs single target" N \color [rgb]{0.6392156862745098,0.5529411764705883,0.42745098039215684}N is number of channel ticks, which is less or equal to max stages. S \color [rgb]{0.6392156862745098,0.5529411764705883,0.42745098039215684}S is number of stages before release, which is less or equal to max stages. Sum of multipliers from stages build up: Damage from release on current stages: Calculating average damage multiplier per channel tick with perfect release: For 6 max stages and 6 ticks: For 7 max stages(helm enchant) and 7 ticks: Blade Flurry can drop anywhere. Maximum blades: Up to 10 blade stacks can be active at a time. Each stack has its own duration. Hit interval: When the blade is first spawned, the skill will deal a hit after the hit interval duration (0.6 seconds with one blade). Multiple copies: You can only have one Blade Vortex effect at any one time. Casting Blade Vortex with another copy of the gem will remove all active stacks and start a new Blade Vortex effect. Multiple casts: Using Blade Vortex while you have no Blade Vortex effect will create a new Blade Vortex effect with all the "spell cast" modifiers baked into that Blade Vortex effect. Any subsequent uses of Blade Vortex will only add a stack to the currently active effect. Note also that Intensity updates on each cast[1], and stats that apply per hit instead of per cast do not snapshot. Visual effect: Blade vortex's visual effect does not scale with Area of effect modifiers. Instead, to give a rough indication of radius, there are several versions of the knife effect, each rotating at a different radius. The skill will always try to have one knife using the largest-radius effect that's not larger than the actual radius of the skill, but that skill results in discrete visual changes where you need to reach a certain threshold before the next wider effect can be used. The full radius is always used mechanically.[2] Blade Vortex's in-game tooltip DPS gives the average damage of one hit from one Blade Vortex instance, multiplied by casts per second. This value is misleading primarily because Blade Vortex can hit more than once over its duration, thus cast speed must not be used, but hits per second (rounds per second, spin rate), over the duration of the stacks. Base spin rate of Blade Vortex is 600 ms. Blade Vortex hit more frequently with more stacks it has. As gem says: 35% increased Hit Rate for each blade.

Hit interval: Unlike regular Blade Vortex, Blade Vortex of the Scythe will deal a hit immediately when the blades are created. Recasting Blade Vortex of the Scythe while there's already an active blade will not cause the skill to deal a hit on cast. To optimize the damage, your cast speed should be slightly longer than the blade duration and have the blade duration be slightly higher than 0.6 seconds. Bladestorm is a melee attack skill that creates a bladestorm that continuously deals damage in an area for a short duration. Its properties change depending on whether the user is in Blood Stance or Sand Stance. Bladestorm has two components: an initial melee attack that deals damage around the player, and a lingering blood or stand storm that will repeatedly (based on attack speed) deal 50% of melee damage to enemies within its area. This skill interacts with Blood and Sand Stance: In either stance, Bladestorm will have more attack speed while inside a blood bladestorm. While the storms have 100% chance to inflict blind or bleeding, the initial hit does not.[1] The storms generated by the initial melee attack will wait for the duration of the attack time to start dealing damage, e.g. if you have an attack time of 0.5 seconds, the storm will start dealing damage after 0.5 seconds. Because hits do not snapshot, existing storms will account for any changes to the skill's stats, including attack rate.[2] When used with General's CryGeneral's CryWarcry, AoE, DurationLevel: (1-20)Cost: (15-19) ManaCooldown Time: 3.00 secCan Store 1 Use(s)Use Time: 0.80 secAoE Radius: 60Requires Level 24Performs a warcry, taunting nearby enemies to attack the user, and summoning Mirage Warriors from nearby corpses. Blink Arrow is an attack that fires an arrow, upon reaching the destination you are teleported there and a clone is summoned at your previous location. The clone is a minion that uses your bow and quiver. The skill happens in four stages: The length of the first stage is affected by anything that affects regular attacks - weapon base speed, attack speed modifiers etc. The length of the second stage is affected both by bonuses to projectile speed and by global bonuses to attack speed, but not by the weapon's base speed[2][3]. The delay is unaffected by distance travelled. Blood and Sand reserves mana to activate Blood Stance and Sand Stance. In Sand Stance, your melee skills have more area of effect, but less area damage. In Blood Stance, your melee skills have more area damage, but less area of effect. Activating the skill while it's toggled on will alternate between stances. Certain skills also behave differently based on the stance you are currently on. Blood Rage applies a buff that deals physical damage to the player over time, while increasing attack speed and life leech. Killing an enemy while this buff is active refreshes the buff duration, and has a chance to grant a frenzy charge. Physical damage reduction: Damage dealt by Blood Rage is lowered by physical damage reduction. Note that armour only reduces physical damage from hits, and thus does not affect the damage taken from Blood Rage. Much like Righteous Fire the damage from this skill does not count as a hit so does not trigger Cast when Damage Taken. Only the most recently applied Blood Rage buff remains active, so triggering Level 1 Blood Rage with an effect such as of the Orderof the OrderSuffix(18-22)% increased Attack Speed15% chance to Trigger Level 1 Blood Rage when you Kill an Enemy after casting level 20 Blood Rage will override the higher level buff. Blood Rage can drop anywhere. Bodyswap is a spell skill. The skill can target an enemy or a corpse, exploding your body and teleporting you to the target. The skill creates an area of effect explosion that deals fire damage, which scales with your maximum life. When targeting a corpse, it deals more damage and the corpse also explodes to deal damage relative to the corpse's maximum life. Bodyswap can drop anywhere. Note that helmet enchantments are no longer obtainable since version 3.23.0 and can only be obtained in permanent leagues as already enchanted items from before this patch.

Bone Offering is an offering spell that consumes one or more corpses, temporarily granting the player's minions a chance to block attacks and spells, and life regeneration if they have blocked recently. The skill consumes a corpse and up to 4 additional corpses around it. Each additional corpse extends the base duration of the skill by 1 second, making the maximum achievable base duration 9 seconds. Each player may only have one offering active at any time. Casting an Offering skill while one is already active will cancel the older one. Bone Offering can drop anywhere. Brand Recall is a spell that recalls all brands to the caster and causes them to activate. Brand Recall can only reach level 6 through regular experience gain, but the required experience to reach level 6 is comparable to that of regular gems. Its level cap can be exceeded the same way as other gems. Activations caused by Brand Recall cannot benefit from against Branded Enemy stats, even if the brand immediately attaches to an enemy. Spends 20% of Brand's Cost is a cost for effects that interact with costs, like Eldritch Battery or Tawhanuku's TimingTawhanuku's TimingMoonstone RingRequires Level 44+(15-25) to maximum Energy Shield(30-40)% increased Spell Damage+(60-80) to maximum Mana(5-10)% chance to Freeze, Shock and IgniteSpells cause you to gain Energy Shield equal to their UpfrontCost every fifth time you Pay itThe soul still beats, even when the heart never did. or stats that count total resource spent. It is not directly affected by cost modifiers (as the modifiers would already apply to the brand's cost, to prevent double-dipping). If the cost of the recalled brands changes, the cost spent by Brand Recall updates to match it. Insufficient mana or life does not prevent the brands from being recalled. Because Brand Recall's natural cooldown is 4 seconds, socketing Brand Recall in a Trigger a Socketed Spell when you Use a Skill, with a 8 second Cooldown weapon replaces its natural cooldown with the longer veiled cooldown. Cold Snap is a spell that deals cold damage to enemies in an area, leaving chilled ground that expands and deals cold damage over time. It has a cooldown that can be bypassed with Frenzy Charges. It also has a 25% chance to grant a frenzy charge when you kill an enemy within its area of effect. Modifiers to Spell Damage apply to this Skill's Damage Over Time effect: this modifier allows spell damage modifiers to modify the skill's natural cold damage over time. It will not apply to other types of damage over time, such as Ignite. Chilled Ground: Cold Snap creates an expanding chilled ground that causes enemies to be chilled. While its base effect will scale with the player or skill's modifiers to cold and non-damaging ailments, it is not considered a chill inflicted by the player, limiting the use of certain stats. (See chilling area.) Trigger: Even if the appropriate charges are available, Cold Snap's cooldown cannot be bypassed when triggered.[1] Cold Snap can drop anywhere. Conversion Trap throws a trap that causes the enemy that triggered it to temporarily become allies with the user. Most normal, magic, and rare rarity monsters can be converted into temporary allies using this skill, but unique monsters cannot. Magic and rare monsters that are converted keep all of their monster modifier effects, including aura like effects. Converted monsters also retain all buffs and debuffs that were present on the monster prior to conversion. Duration: Modifiers to skill duration affect the duration of enemy's conversion state. Modifiers to buff and debuff duration or expiry rate do not apply. Hostile totems can be turned into allies using Conversion Trap. Auras from the totem will affect the player and a Shockwave Totem will attack the player's enemies. Temporary allies: Monsters converted by Conversion Trap are not considered minions and do not scale with minion-specific stats or minion support gems. In PvP content, Conversion Trap can not affect players; however, their minions can be converted.[1] Warriors found in the Trial of the Ancestors cannot be converted. Conversion Trap can drop anywhere. Conversion Trap can be created from the following recipes: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests: The following helmet enchantments affect Conversion Trap. Note that helmet enchantments are no longer obtainable since version 3.23.0 and can only be obtained in permanent leagues as already enchanted items from before this patch.

Creeping Frost is a projectile cold spell that launches a frozen skull at a targeted area. The projectile will explode when it reaches the targeted area, or if it comes into contact with an enemy. This explosion causes initial damage and creates a Chilling Area that slows and deals cold damage over time to any enemies that enter it. This chilling area will move in the direction of nearby enemies. Creeping Frost's chilling area is not considered Chilled Ground. Enemies affected by Creeping Frost's chilling area counts as being Chilled by you. Creeping Frost can drop anywhere. Defiance Banner is a banner aura skill. After gaining Valour from melee combat, it can be activated, consuming all Valour and placing a banner that buffs the user and allies within an area with increased movement speed, additional chance to suppress spell damage, and a flat subtraction to damage taken from suppressed spell hits. The effect of the aura is multiplied based on the amount of Valour consumed. When the banner is placed with 50 Valour, the buff provides 48% increased Movement Speed to You and Allies, +48% chance to Suppress Spell Damage to You and Allies, and -72 Damage taken of each Damage Type from Suppressed Hits to You and Allies. Defiance Banner can drop anywhere. This list is retained even upon exiting the area, removing the Raise Spectre gem, after your Spectres die or are unsummoned, or logging out. There is currently no way to clear a spectre bank; it can only be ignored by removing the Raise Spectre gem. Spectral Corpses will only be created if at least one monster is in your spectre bank. Before 10 or more different monsters are saved in the spectre bank, each additional spectre saved dilutes the chance for the Spectral Corpse to be a specific spectre. After 10 or more spectres are saved, the chance does not get further diluted, and the oldest monster saved will be removed from the spectre bank. To share spectres between players, the players should join the same hideout area. After doing so, either player will be able to spawn spectral corpses of other players in the area.

Destructive Link is a Link skill that targets an allied player to apply a buff which links you to them for a duration. While linked, they use your critical strike chance for main hand hits. If the target dies while linked, you will also die. This skill cannot be used by Totems, Traps, or Mines. This skill replaces the linked target's main hand critical strike chance with yours; this uses the value in the player's character sheet which is affected by modifiers to critical strike chance, not just the base critical strike chance of the weapon. Detonate Mines is a skill gem that performs the same function as the gem-less detonate skill that is automatically made available when a player has used a mine. Unlike detonating mines using the hotkey, the Detonate Mines skill gem can take advantage of mechanics afforded by being linked to support gems. Detonate Mines can drop anywhere. Detonate Mines can be created from the following recipes: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests: Detonate Mines cannot be obtained from quests or traded for using an Uncarved GemstoneUncarved GemstoneTrade this in to Siosa inside the Library for a Skill Gem through Siosa in Ruthless mode.

Devouring Totem summons a totem that can consume nearby corpses. Each corpse consumed will leech life and mana to the player. It will consume corpses when the player is missing either life or mana. Totem range is 60. The life and mana leech granted by Devouring Totem can be scaled by increases or reductions to life and mana leech rate as well as life and mana recovery rate. Can be combined with keystones such as Vaal Pact or Ghost Reaver. Devouring Totem can drop anywhere. Elemental Hit is an melee attack skill that randomly deals fire, cold, or lightning damage in an area of effect around the target with each use. That use of Elemental Hit will only deal damage of the chosen element, and has more area of effect against enemies affected by the elemental ailments of that element. The skill deals more damage for each elemental ailment present on enemies. Elemental Hit can be used with any melee weapon or while unarmed. Elemental Hit can drop anywhere. Elemental Hit of the Spectrum is a ranged attack skill that fires a projectile which deals fire, cold, and lightning damage. Hitting an enemy will cause it to also deal damage in an area of effect around the enemy. The skill deals more damage for each elemental ailment present on enemies. You cannot deal physical or chaos damage with this skill. Ensnaring Arrow is a bow attack skill which fires an arrow that tethers to the ground behind the enemy it hits, debuffing it with Snared. The ensnared enemy has less movement speed per snare (up to 3), takes increased hit damage from projectile attacks. Snares are removed when the enemy moves out of the arrow's area of effect. Split/Pierce/Fork/Chain/Return: Ensnaring Arrow cannot ensnare an enemy if the arrow continues from the enemy due to any projectile behaviours. Arrows that pierce or fork will never ensnare a target. Returning arrows can ensnare an enemy if the arrow collides and stops at that enemy. Arrows that have remaining chains can ensnare an enemy if there are no other eligible enemies to chain to. Ensnaring Arrow can drop anywhere. This article describes new Path of Exile content released in version 3.25.0. Information may be missing or incorrect. Please expand this article so that it provides complete and accurate information. Eviscerate is a retaliation melee attack skill that unleashes two arcing waves of force in front of the user that applies bleeding. This skill requires a shield and a sword or axe to use. This skill becomes usable after blocking a hit. Eviscerate fires two simultaneous rectangular damaging areas in a V shape in front of you. Because of the angle of the attack and the shape of the damaging areas, the attack may miss name-locked targets if they are far enough away from the user in the area between the damaging areas. However, close targets can be hit twice, once by each damaging area. Eviscerate can drop anywhere. Explosive Arrow is a bow attack skill that fires an arrow which sticks to terrain or enemies and explodes after a duration, dealing damage in an area. Any additional arrows stuck to an enemy will add their damage to the explosion, while also granting more damage with hits, damaging ailments, and area of effect. Explosive Arrow has two separate damaging mechanics: arrow collisions and exploding arrows.[1] Collision: Attacking fires a regular arrow, colliding with enemies and dealing damage with no special mechanics. Instead of disappearing, arrows remain stuck to terrain or enemies for a duration. Sticking additional arrows in an enemy does not affect the duration of other arrows. Explosion: When the duration of an arrow expires, the maximum number of stuck arrows is reached, or a target dies, all arrows on a target will explode for area projectile damage. Each arrow calculates its own damage, individually, including critical strike chance and chance to inflict damaging ailments. Hit damage and ailment dps from each arrow are then combined and applied as a single hit and debuff.[2] If any contributing arrow deals a critical strike, the combined hit counts as a critical strike for relevant effects, though without further modifying damage.[3] The Explosion deals 50% less Base Damage stat only modifies base damage, meaning flat damage contributed by local values on your bow.[4] Projectile Mechanics: Arrows cannot stick in enemies if they continue due to Chain, Pierce, Fork, Split or Return. Explosive Trap is a spell that throws a trap that creates multiple explosions when triggered. It deals physical damage that's converted to fire damage. The base radius of the large explosion is 1.2m, and the base radius of the small explosions is 0.7m, with the default size having a radius of 1.0m. Both of these radii are increased by the +x metres to radius gained from gem levels and by modifiers to Area of Effect. The chance that a small explosion will hit a targeted enemy can be calculated as ( r s m a l l + r e n e m y − 0.1 m ) 2 / ( r l a r g e ) 2 \color [rgb]{0.6392156862745098,0.5529411764705883,0.42745098039215684}(r_{small}+r_{enemy}-0.1m)^{2}/(r_{large})^{2} . Increases to radius improve the overlap chance of small explosions on the targeted enemy by increasing the ratio of the small radius to the large radius, while increased area of effect may either increase or decrease the overlap chance, as different breakpoints in the calculation of the large and small radius are reached.[1] Explosive Trap can drop anywhere. Eye of Winter is a cold spell that fires a projectile that deals no damage but that constantly releases shard projectiles in a spiral over its lifetime, and then on dissipation or collision with terrain explodes in an additional spiral of shard projectiles. The spell will fire 31 shards over its lifetime, and then explode for an additional 8 (+1 per 10 quality) shards. Additional Projectiles: Sources of additional projectiles do not increase the number of primary eye projectiles fired through casting this spell. These behaviors do apply to the secondary shard projectiles, however. Right click to remove from a socket., both the primary and secondary projectiles will return in the direction of the player's current position. Projectiles that dissipate before reaching their maximum range will not return however, thus this will usually only occur when the projectiles hit an obstacle, such as walls or elevated terrain. Projectile Speed: Modifiers to projectile speed affect both types of projectiles from this skill- the eye and the secondary shard projectiles. If projectile speed is increased, for example, the eye projectile travels further than it normally would, as do the shard projectiles, which would travel further before they dissipate. This can effectively increase the coverage area of this skill. Bear in mind, however, that the faster the eye projectile, the larger the gap formed between shard projectiles unleashed in the spiral; this may cause single targets close to the caster to take less damage than if the eye projectile travels slower. Spiral of Shard Projectiles: This skill fires an "eye" projectile which fires out secondary "shard" projectiles as it travels. These shards are released constantly as the eye travels, and if a target is directly in the center of the eye, the multiple shards can hit that target. This behavior also applies to the final spiral that is triggered upon the eye projectile reaching the end of its lifetime (through reaching its maximum distance or colliding with terrain). Though it may look like an explosion, it is indeed a very fast sequential spiral, meaning that with careful positioning by the player, a single target may be hit by all projectiles in this last spiral, effectively "shotgunning" this target. Traps and Mines: This skill can be turned into traps or mines with the appropriate support gems. Eye of Winter has 2 variants: Eye of Winter can drop anywhere.

Firestorm is a spell that rains numerous fiery bolts in an area, each bolt dealing area of effect fire damage. Area of Effect: Increased AoE will increase both the area in which the fireballs randomly fall and also the radius of the individual fireball damage. Full spell damage is done at any point within the AoE of a fireball. However, increasing the size of the spell area means that each monster within the spell area is within fewer individual fireball bursts[1]; thus, less spell damage is dealt to any single enemy as area increases. For this reason increasing the AoE of Firestorm paradoxically decreases the average damage dealt to a single target. Duration: Increasing duration with either supports or passives will increase the total number of fireballs that fall before the spell ends. Damage Effectiveness: Damage from secondary sources like 'added damage' supports or heralds applies at only 80% of their listed value. Damage per Second: Due to the complexity of estimating actual DPS of the skill including all possible factors, ingame tooltip shows only average damage per hit of one fireball, with actual DPS of the skill being considerably higher. The closest currently available estimate can be obtained by using the damage calculator. Firestorm can drop anywhere. Flame Link is a Link skill that targets an allied player to apply a buff which links you to them for a duration. While linked, they deal additional fire damage based on your life. If the target dies while linked, you will also die. This skill cannot be used by Totems, Traps, or Mines. Flame Link can drop anywhere. Flame Surge is a spell that deals fire damage in a narrow area of effect in front of the caster. It deals more damage against burning enemies. The skill itself cannot inflict ignite, but hitting an ignited enemy with Flame Surge leaves behind burning ground that deals damage proportional to the ignite damage. Area of Effect: Flame Surge fires a wave of flame in a very narrow cone, increasing the area of effect radius will increase the effective range of the skill. Damage Bonus: All sources of burning enable the damage bonus. Flame Surge of Combusting is a spell that deals fire damage in a narrow area of effect in front of the caster. It has a chance to Ignite, which also leaves Burning Ground that deals damage proportional to the ignite damage. It is a transfigured version of Flame SurgeFlame SurgeSpell, AoE, Fire, DurationLevel: (1-20)Cost: (6-16) ManaCast Time: 0.50 secCritical Strike Chance: 6.00%Effectiveness of Added Damage: 190%AoE Radius: 30Requires Level 12Strikes enemies in front of you with a surge of flame. Burning enemies are dealt more damage. If you hit an ignited enemy, will create burning ground under them. Your damage modifiers don't apply to this burning ground.Base duration is 4.00 secondsDeals (26-832) to (40-1247) Fire Damage(50-88)% more Damage with Hits against Burning enemiesCannot Ignite+(0-9) to Area of Effect lengthHits on Ignited Enemies create Burning Ground, no more than once every 2 secondsBurning Ground deals 25% of Fire Damage per second of Ignite affecting Enemy Additional Effects From 1-20% Quality: +(1-20)% more Damage with Hits against Burning enemiesPlace into an item socket of the right colour to gain this skill. Right click to remove from a socket.. Unlike the original skill, this transfigured version can ignite, and create burning ground on ignite rather than when hitting an ignited enemy, with a higher percentage of the ignite's DPS. It also costs more mana and has a slower cast time, but has more damage and damage effectiveness. It no longer has a multiplier for hits against burning enemies. Gem quality increases the burning ground damage scaling instead. Burning Ground scaling: modifiers to burning damage, fire damage, etc. all apply to the initial ignite inflicted by this skill. To prevent double-dipping, these do not also affect the burning ground created by this skill. However, due to the specific base damage source of the ground effect—raw DPS of the ignite—it can be increased at a greater degree than the total damage of the ignite. This can be accomplished through the use of "faster" modifiers to ignites, most notably Sadism Support which, while reducing total ignite damage, greatly increases actual second-to-second DPS of the ignite and burning ground alike. As an independent skill effect, the burning ground is not tied to the duration of the ignite. Absent any skill effect duration modifiers, the burning ground will always last 4 seconds. Flame Surge of Combusting has restrictions on where or how it can drop. This item is a transfigured gem. It can be obtained through the use of the Divine Font in the Lord's Labyrinth. Flame Surge of Combusting can be created from the following recipes: The following helmet enchantments affect Flame Surge. Note that helmet enchantments are no longer obtainable since version 3.23.0 and can only be obtained in permanent leagues as already enchanted items from before this patch. Flesh and Stone is an aura skill that activates Blood and Sand Stance. In Blood Stance (Flesh), the aura debuffs nearby enemies to take more physical damage from hits. In Sand Stance (Stone), the user is buffed to take less hit damage from entities inside the aura. Both effects are stronger the closer enemies are to the user. Activating the skill while it's toggled on will alternate between stances. Certain skills also behave differently based on the stance you are currently in. Nearby: Enemies within 1.5 metres of the user receive the full effect, which scales linearly down to 0 at the edge of the area. Increasing the aura's radius only affects the edge of the area and does not affect the 1.5 metre range for maximum effect. Increasing the aura radius does affect the interpolation between the two circles, however.[1] Aura effect: Aura effect will scale the Nearby Enemies take up to 10% more Physical Damage from Hits while in Blood Stance stat, but not Take up to 10% less Damage from Nearby Enemies while in Sand Stance; the less Damage taken stat is an effect of the buff, not the aura. Flesh Offering is an offering spell that consumes one or more corpses, temporarily granting the player's minions swiftness. The skill consumes a corpse and up to 4 additional corpses around it. Each additional corpse extends the base duration of the skill by 1 second, making the maximum achievable base duration 9 seconds. Each player may only have one Offering active at any time. Casting an Offering skill while one is already active will cancel the older one. Flesh Offering can drop anywhere. Flesh Offering can be created from the following recipes: This item is given as a quest reward for the following quests: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests: The following helmet enchantments affect Flesh Offering. Note that helmet enchantments are no longer obtainable since version 3.23.0 and can only be obtained in permanent leagues as already enchanted items from before this patch. The following unique items are related to Flesh Offering:

Flicker Strike is a melee attack skill that teleports the character to a nearby enemy and strikes it with their weapon and grants increased movement speed for a short time. If no specific monster is chosen, one is picked at random. The skill has a cooldown that can be bypassed by expending a Frenzy Charge and has a chance to generate a Frenzy Charge when used. The character is considered to be stationary while flickering for the purpose of receiving buffs such as the Inexorable notable passive skill, and that they have moved each time they flickered. For this reason the character never benefits from "while moving" buffs, and the timers for scaling stationary buffs are continuously reset.[1] Minimum Frenzy Charges cannot be consumed to bypass the cooldown. Dual Wielding while using Flicker Strike will cause the player to alternate weapons each attack. Flicker Strike can target an enemy within a distance of 4 meters by default. This is unaffected by modifiers to area of effect. Modifiers to Melee Strike Range have no special interaction with teleports: you will neither "land" farther from the target when you flicker, nor will you be able to initiate an attack from farther away. Flicker Strike can drop anywhere. Flicker Strike can be created from the following recipes: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests: The following helmet enchantments affect Flicker Strike. Note that helmet enchantments are no longer obtainable since version 3.23.0 and can only be obtained in permanent leagues as already enchanted items from before this patch. Projectiles: By default, Forbidden Rite fires a projectile near your cursor, as well as additional projectiles for each enemy within range. This means that on single target, two projectiles will hit the enemy. Sources of additional projectiles will only add projectiles to the initial cursor-targeted projectile, and not the extra projectiles fired towards nearby enemies. The projectiles appear to have an expanding ring-based hit distribution, and it is recommended not to get more than +4 additional projectiles from various sources due to the tendency for projectiles to miss on smaller single targets. The projectiles appear to have a homing behaviour and will bend towards targeted enemies. The projectile is ground targeted and does not benefit from Chain, Fork, Split, Pierce or any projectile behaviour modifiers. However, Projectile Speed will greatly reduce the time between casting the skill and the impact of the projectile, enhancing the skill performance against moving enemies.

Frenzy is a ranged attack that grants frenzy charges on hit and also gains large bonuses from them. It requires a bow or wand. Frost Shield is a spell that creates a chilling area around the caster for a duration. The area drains your energy shield when initially cast, and uses the absorbed energy shield to redirect a percentage of the damage the user takes to itself while the user is within it. The user also gains increased spell critical strike chance while within the field. Chilling Area: Enemies that are inside the chilling area become chilled by the player. Modifiers to chill and cold/non-damaging ailments apply, including from support gems. It can apply chilled by you stats, enable if you have chilled recently stats, and cannot chill when the player or skill cannot chill. Energy Shield Recharge: Recharge is disabled while the effect is draining energy shield. Despite not being damage, the drain also interrupts ES recharge, which Wicked Ward may prevent.[1] Frost Shield can drop anywhere. Support Gems, also known as simply supports, are an item class of gems used to modify the behaviours of supported skill gems. Previously known as support skill gems, their name was changed to prevent confusion as supports are not actually skills. Instead of granting a specific skill like skill gems do, support gems modify any compatible skill gem linked to the support, modifying its behaviours as well as applying a mana cost multiplier. Many support-skill gem combinations are invalid; for example, a ClarityClarityAura, Spell, AoELevel: (1-20)Reservation: (34-279) ManaCooldown Time: 1.20 secCan Store 1 Use(s)Cast Time: InstantAoE Radius: 36Requires Level 10Casts an aura that grants mana regeneration to you and your allies.+(0-1.9) metres to radiusYou and nearby Allies Regenerate (2.9-33) Mana per second Additional Effects From 1-20% Quality: (2-40)% increased Area of EffectPlace into an item socket of the right colour to gain this skill. Right click to remove from a socket. skill gem linked with Added Fire Damage SupportAdded Fire Damage SupportFire, Physical, SupportIcon: FLevel: (1-20)Cost & Reservation Multiplier: 120%Requires Level 8Supports any skill that hits enemies.Supported Skills gain (25-39)% of Physical Damage as Extra Fire Damage Additional Effects From 1-20% Quality: Supported Skills deal (0.5-10)% increased Fire DamageThis is a Support Gem. It does not grant a bonus to your character, but to skills in sockets connected to it. Place into an item socket connected to a socket containing the Skill Gem you wish to augment. Right click to remove from a socket. will remain unchanged. Please note that gem tags do not determine the supportability.[1] Multiple skill gems may be linked to a single support gem, in which case the support will modify all supported skills. Multiple support gems may be linked to a skill gem, in which case the skill gem will be modified by all of the supports. However, if two copies of a given support gem are linked to the same skill, only the higher level gem will apply. If a body armour contains two copies of a skill gem linked to different sets of support gems, two separate versions of the skill will be available, each with their own modifications. This may be desirable if for instance one version has been modified for single target damage, while another has been modified for area of effect damage. Support Gems add an icon in the form of a coloured letter or symbol to any supported skills' icons on the Skill Bar. Support gems with a given gem tag (e.g. fire/minion) do not benefit from modifiers like +1 to Level of all # (e.g. Fire/Minion) Skill Gems, as support gems are not skill gems..[2] This includes hybrid gems with both support and skill components, such as Impending Doom SupportImpending Doom SupportSupport, Hex, Spell, AoE, Chaos, TriggerIcon: XLevel: (1-20)Cost & Reservation Multiplier: 130%Cooldown Time: 0.15 secCan Store 3 Use(s)Cast Time: 1.00 secCritical Strike Chance: 5.00%Requires Level 31Supports hex curse skills, causing them to trigger Doom Blast when the hex ends. Awakened support gems and their non-awakened counterparts are considered the same gem. If a skill gem is simultaneously supported by an awakened support and its non-awakened counterpart, only the awakened support gem's effects will apply, if possible. Ancestral Call is a support gem. Strike skills that are linked to Ancestral Call will target two additional nearby enemies at the same time, automatically selecting valid targets within range for the attacks. The effect that targets additional nearby enemies can only target enemies outside the strike range of the attacker's own animation. It has a minimum and a maximum range; an enemy cannot be too close or too far from the attacker to be targeted.[1] The base maximum appears to be approximately 3.5 metres, and can be increased by this support's gem quality and the anoint-only Sione's Ambition. The targeting range is unrelated to weapon range or melee strike range. The 'Ancestors' summoned at targeted enemies are client-side visual effects, not separate entities. Effects like damage reflection and leech will apply to the player normally.[2][3] When an additional nearby enemy is targeted, the strike against them can also hit other enemies (typically behind the target), depending on the skill's weapon range. While strike range is normally small, it can be raised through modifiers, which some skills may have by default (e.g. Frost Blades of KatabasisFrost Blades of KatabasisAttack, Melee, Strike, Cold, AoE, DurationLevel: (1-20)Cost: (6-10) ManaAttack Damage: (143-409)% of baseEffectiveness of Added Damage: (143-409)%Attack enemies with greatly increased range, creating a chilling area that deals cold damage over time if it hits. Requires a Melee Weapon.Base duration is 3.00 secondsDeals (9.6-3344.4) Base Cold Damage per secondThis Skill's Area of Effect cannot be modified60% of Physical Damage Converted to Cold Damage+5 metres to Melee Strike Range Additional Effects From 1-20% Quality: +(0.05-1) metres to Melee Strike RangePlace into an item socket of the right colour to gain this skill. Right click to remove from a socket.). Because Strike skills perform one critical strike roll per attack, hits against additional enemies require the same chance to crit as the player's own strike. Arrogance Support is a support gem. It grants the supported skills increased aura effect and causes them to reserve life instead of mana, similar to the Blood Magic keystone, but at the expense of a very high reservation multiplier ((220%-201%) for level 1-20 gems). This gem is typically used on Low life builds that also have a high energy shield as the effective life (ehp) pool. The damage multiplier of reoccur portion of the cast, depends on how often the skill is cast and can be estimated (for a lvl 5 gem) using the following equation: 100 % − 38 % 0.66 second \color [rgb]{0.6392156862745098,0.5529411764705883,0.42745098039215684}{\dfrac {100\%-38\%}{0.66{\text{second}}}} or approximately: 6.06 % less DPS \color [rgb]{0.6392156862745098,0.5529411764705883,0.42745098039215684}{6.06\%{\text{ less DPS}}} This assume the player have matching cast time that equal to 0.66 second : 1.51 cast per second to achieve this dps for reoccur portion of the cast. This does not take into account of gem quality Supported Skills deal 0.5% increased Spell Damage (per 1% quality) which is multiplicative with Supported Skills deal (40-38)% less Damage when Reoccurring. Blind is a support gem that provides supported skills with a chance to inflict blind, which greatly reduces an enemy's chance to hit for a short duration. Spells do not have a chance to hit (spell always hit and does not take evasion and accuracy into calculation) , the ability to hit with a spell is unaffected by being blinded. Thus, using this support against monster that use spell did not have any effect. Some unique items still provide additional damage against blinded monsters. An attacker's chance to hit with attack skill, is the direct opposite of the defender's chance to evade. Since player characters with Unwavering Stance cannot evade, attacks made against them always hit. As a result, even blinded monster will always have 100% chance to hit a player character with Unwavering Stance (if assuming zero dodge), since the Unwavering Stance character always has 0% chance to evade. Similarly, attacks made by characters with Resolute Technique cannot be evaded, so blind has no effect beyond the sight radius reduction. This also applies to attack that have the mod Hits can't be Evaded during PVP. Bloodthirst Support is a support gem that grants more damage to attacks made with the supported skill. It also grants added flat physical damage with weapons based on your maximum life pool to the skill while on low life. Bloodthirst's more damage modifier is active unconditionally, whether the character is on low life or not. The flat added physical damage is a conditional modifier, because it is only active while on low life and using a weapon. Damage Calculations The total damage depends on the characters maximum life and total flat damage from other sources. These calculations count both the flat physical damage and the more damage. Therefore they assume the character is on low life and using a weapon. Add up all flat sources of damage not from the gem = Q (Total life X .02) = Y ( Q + Y ) = K ( K X More damage) = V (V / Q) = final answer. Colours indicate scenarios where Level 20 Melee Physical Damage Support or Level 5 Awakened Melee Physical Damage Support would be more beneficial. Bloodthirst Support can drop anywhere. Bonechill Support is a support gem that grants the supported skill more cold damage and increased chill effect. Chills from supported skills also cause enemies to take increased cold damage (from all sources) equal to the strongest chill affecting them. Bonechill Support adds the increase Cold Damage taken by Chill Effect stat to chill debuffs from supported skills, as well as to chilling areas created by them. This is a boolean property, and accordingly does not stack when enemies are both chilled by a skill and inside that skill's chilling area.[1] Chill Effect refers to the enemy's strongest #% reduced Action Speed from any chill. This does not need to be applied by the same chill debuff: one chill can apply Bonechill, and another chill can apply the strongest action speed reduction.[2] This means the player can choose to support a secondary skill with Bonechill (e.g. FrostblinkFrostblinkSpell, Movement, Duration, Cold, Travel, Blink, AoELevel: (1-20)Cost: (12-22) ManaCooldown Time: (3.00 sec-2.60 sec)Can Store 1 Use(s)Cast Time: InstantCritical Strike Chance: 5.00%Effectiveness of Added Damage: (180-250)%Requires Level 4Teleport to a location, damaging enemies and leaving Chilled ground in an area at both ends of the teleport. Cast on Critical Strike (commonly referred to as CoC) is a support gem that causes linked spells to trigger when the player critically strikes with a linked attack skill. If more than one spell is supported by Cast on Critical Support, the order of the triggered spells will follow the trigger order. (Successive triggers cycle through all valid supported spells in the same order.) Each supported skill has its own cooldown, except multiple copies of the same spell, which share their cooldown. Due to how server frames are calculated, there are breakpoints of cooldown recovery rates required to achieve a higher effective trigger rate.[1]. Additional cooldown reduction that does not reach the next threshold is wasted. The attack rates below are maximums; exceeding the attack rates even slightly can significantly reduce proc rate due to skipping procs while the skill is still on cooldown. It is better to be slightly below the attack rate than above it. Note that multiples of the attack rate also work (e.g. 12.12 APS will proc at the same rate as 6.06 APS). Cast On Critical Strike Support can drop anywhere. Each of these pieces can be from gems, or one of them can be replaced by modifiers or skills granted by items. Cast on Melee Kill is a support gem. It causes linked spells to trigger when the player kills an enemy with the melee attack portion of a supported melee skill. Melee Kill: Spells can only be triggered by kills with melee attack damage. Enemies killed by damage over time (e.g. Bleeding applied by a melee hit) will not trigger supported spells.[1] Trigger gem: Cast on Melee Kill has default behaviour, see cooldown and trigger. Cast on Melee Kill Support can drop anywhere. Cast when Damage Taken is a support gem. It causes a linked spell to trigger when the player takes a certain amount of damage from hits. Trigger gem: Cast when Damage Taken supports spells. Multiple different spells can be supported, and each will have their own damage taken counter and cooldown. Multiple copies of Cast when Damage Taken will also function independently, as long as they don't support copies of the same active skill, which would cause a shared cooldown. Because spells will only be triggered after the damage is taken, Cast when Damage Taken linked to a guard skill will never save the player from a killing blow; the character will die before the spell is triggered. Damage counter and trigger cooldown: The Cast when Damage Taken gem itself does not have a counter or cooldown, only spells it supports do.[1] Each supported skill has an internal damage counter that tracks the total accumulated damage taken from hits. Damage over time and non-damage loss do not contribute to this counter, i.e. you cannot use Righteous FireRighteous FireSpell, AoE, FireLevel: (1-20)Cooldown Time: 0.30 secCan Store 1 Use(s)Cast Time: InstantRequires Level 16Engulfs you in magical fire that rapidly burns you and nearby enemies. Your spell damage is substantially increased while under this effect. The effect ends when you have 1 life remaining.Deals 70% of your Maximum Life as Base Fire Damage per secondDeals 70% of your Maximum Energy Shield as Base Fire Damage per secondYou Burn for 90% of your Maximum Life per second as Fire DamageYou Burn for 70% of your Maximum Energy Shield per second as Fire DamageGrants (20-39)% more Spell DamageBase radius is (1.8-2.3) metres Additional Effects From 1-20% Quality: Base radius is (0.015-0.3) metresPlace into an item socket of the right colour to gain this skill. Right click to remove from a socket. to trigger Cast when Damage Taken.[2] All damage counters will be reset to 0 upon entering a new area. A skill does not track damage taken while it is on cooldown. If the damage threshold is met but the skill cannot trigger (e.g. due to insufficient mana), the damage counter resets. Skill cooldowns: Because skills can only have one cooldown, Cast when Damage Taken does not add its 0.25s cooldown to skills that already have a cooldown that's equal or higher. Maximum level of supported skills: Cast when Damage Taken cannot support skills with a higher level requirement than that of Cast when Damage Taken itself. This restriction only applies to skill gems; support gems are not affected. Trigger order: If multiple triggers proc simultaneously, skills triggered follow a set order. Targeting: Triggered spells will target the location of the entity that dealt the hit that caused the trigger. Reflected damage is considered to come from the enemy which the damage was reflected from. If triggered by self-damage, it will target a random enemy, or if there are no enemies, it will target the player's location or a random direction, depending on the triggered skill.[3][4] Cast when Damage Taken Support can drop anywhere. Cast when Damage Taken Support can be created from the following recipes: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests: The following unique items are related to Cast when Damage Taken Support: Cast when Damage Taken Support has the following alternate skill effects: Cats when Damage Taken was a trigger gem available only on April 1, 2015 as an April Fool's joke.[5] Like Cast when Damage Taken, it caused a linked spell to activate when the player accumulated damage taken, but besides casting the spell, it also summoned black cats. Other properties were identical to the Cast when Damage Taken skill.

Cast when Stunned is a support gem that grants supported spells a chance to trigger when the player is stunned or blocks a stunning hit. Different spells supported by Cast when Stunned are independent: when the character is stunned or blocks a stunning hit, each supported spell rolls its own chance to trigger, and each spell that succeeds its chance check will trigger and go on its own cooldown. Because multiple copies of the same spell (or a transfigured variant) with the same trigger share a cooldown, supporting duplicate spells with Cast when Stunned will only result in two chance rolls, never two triggers. Triggered spells will target the location of the enemy that stunned the player. Chance to Flee Support is a support gem that grants supported skills a chance to cause monsters to flee when they are hit by those skills. Enemies hit by the supported skill will have a Chance to Flee; they will attempt to run to a random point somewhere away from the character until they reach a certain point, are interrupted, or are unable to reach their selected point and give up. If a fleeing enemy becomes stunned, their fleeing behaviour will be interrupted. Magic monsters have a 50% chance to avoid fleeing for any reason, and rare monsters are immune to this gem's effects. Some monsters naturally flee when they are burning. This includes apes, humanoids and sea witches. This support gem has limited usage, as groups of normal and magic monsters are usually not dangerous enough to threaten a character. Causing a monster to flee often increases the amount of effort required to kill them, as packs can scatter in different directions lowering the efficiency of attacks and spells that target an area. The gem may benefit characters using the far Shot keyword, or characters who cause bleeding and want to ensure weak targets still take the increased damage rate caused by movement. Characters using bows and seeking increased bleeding damage might be better served by the Ensnaring Arrow skill gem. Chance to Flee Support can drop anywhere. Chance to Flee Support can be created from the following recipes: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests:

Close Combat Support is a support gem which grants the supported attack more melee damage based on how close the user is to the enemy. It also causes the skill to grant Combat Rush on hit, a buff which grants the next travel skill used within 2 seconds more attack speed. This support gem restricts the skill to swords and axes. The "up to x% more damage" stat on Close Combat support (and the matching stat on the Slayer's Impact notable) applies the full damage bonus to targets up to a distance of 1.5 metres from you, then linearly scales down the bonus to 0 at a distance of 4 metres.[1] Close Combat appears to be a buff, scaling with IchimonjiIchimonjiCorsair SwordOne Handed SwordPhysical Damage: (45-58.5) to (167.4-195)Critical Strike Chance: 5.00%Attacks per Second: (1.86-1.94)Weapon Range: 1.1 metresRequires Level 58, 81 Str, 117 Dex40% increased Global Accuracy Rating(80-95)% increased Physical DamageAdds (5-10) to (13-20) Physical Damage(20-25)% increased Attack Speed10% increased Effect of Buffs on you10% increased Mana Reservation Efficiency of SkillsAllies' Aura Buffs do not affect youYour Aura Buffs do not affect alliesMaster yourself before you seek to master others., but lacks the typical green-bordered icon. Cluster Traps is a support gem that changes the laying behaviour of any supported traps. Instead of throwing a single trap, three traps are thrown at once, but these traps will be placed randomly in a radius around the targeted location and do less damage than normal. The maximum number of traps of the linked skill is also increased by five. Throwing function - Cluster Trap skills can be thrown to locations of different heights, across gaps, and, unlike Multiple Traps Support, do not have a minimum throwing range. When paired with Multiple Traps, the rules for trap placement follow Cluster Trap's throwing patterns. Cluster radius - Traps thrown with Cluster Trap will always land within 20 units of the targeted enemy or location. Notably, this means with enough % increased Trap Trigger Area of Effect it is possible to increase your traps' trigger radius enough that they will always trigger against a stationary target. For standard sized enemies (radius of 2 units), this is achieved with a trap trigger radius of 18, a total of 224% increased Trap Trigger Area of Effect. Combustion is a support gem that grants supported skills that grants more fire damage and chance to ignite the enemy. Enemies ignited by the supported skill have reduced fire resistance for the duration of the ignite applying Combustion. Note that even though this skill 'Supports any skill that hits enemies', by default only fire damage can ignite. Therefore it by default only helps skills dealing fire damage, see more on ignite, including uniques that enable other elements to ignite. The fire damage could be supplied by gear or for minions for instance a jewel with 'Minions deal additional Fire Damage'. The Chance to Ignite an enemy given by this gem is independent of the chance to ignite an enemy as a result of a critical strike. The overall probability that an enemy will be ignited is: ChanceToIgnite = 1 − ( 1 − SkillCritChance ) ∗ ( 1 − SkillIgniteChance ) \color [rgb]{0.6392156862745098,0.5529411764705883,0.42745098039215684}{\text{ChanceToIgnite}}=1-(1-{\text{SkillCritChance}})*(1-{\text{SkillIgniteChance}}) It is worth noting that as opposed to chance to critical strike, which is checked once for each cast of the skill, the chance to ignite is checked separately for each individual hit. Controlled Blaze is a support gem that causes melee attacks to have an increased chance to ignite and for each Ignite inflicted with the Skill recently, it deals less Damage but more Ignite Damage. Controlled Blaze will count all hits that have applied ignite, for each monster that received an ignite and any ignite that has been re-applied to an already ignited enemy. Due to the fact that more and less modifiers are multiplicative, Controlled Blaze will provide less DPS at high number of ignites applied recently. Depending on the gem level, the number of ignites you need to inflict to reach its highest damage bonus is 12 or 13.[2] This results in a "sweet spot" of 3 to 3.25 attacks per second (assuming no other targets); however, it is better to exceed this value to account for time not spent attacking while dodging/repositioning. That said, in general, you can be about 4 ignites off from the optimal range before you start experiencing a >5% ignite DPS loss. Controlled Blaze Support can drop anywhere. Cruelty Support is a support gem. Hits from active skills supported by this gem grant the Cruelty buff. Per its reminder text, Cruelty makes all Skills Supported by Cruelty Support deal up to 40% more Damage over Time, based on the amount of Damage in the Hit which grants it. The buff affects all skills supported by any Cruelty Support. Damaging ailments inflicted by a hit that grants Cruelty are not affected by that instance of Cruelty, because damage calculation occurs before on-hit buffs are gained. Proxies cannot gain or grant the player Cruelty. Damage over time from a proxy's skill can benefit from Cruelty Support if the player obtains a Cruelty buff from a different skill that deals damage directly.[1] (This is likely not an option for totems due to Ancestral Bond.) Damage over time: because damage over time does not hit, it cannot cull. Culling Strike Support can drop anywhere. Decay Support is a support gem that makes hits from supported skills inflict Decay, a chaos damage over time debuff. Decay is a chaos damage over time debuff. It is not affected by modifiers to skill effect duration[1] and does not add a duration to supported skills. Since Decay is a debuff, only one instance will ever apply at a time - it does not stack. The highest damage active instance of the debuff will apply. Reapplying the debuff will refresh the duration. Decay damage is considered damage from the supported skill, and is affected by all relevant modifiers of that skill, including global stats from the player, stats from support gems, and stats inherent to the active skill. This support gem has a drawback of disabling the application of any elemental ailments with supported skills, even if it has stats that grant the ability to always inflict ailments. Empower is a support gem that increases the gem level of supported active skill gems. Empower is a drop-only gem that doesn't have any effect at level one and has a level cap of 3. Empower only affects skill gems, meaning skills granted from items can't be supported by it. Empower Support can drop anywhere. Eternal Blessing Support is a support gem that makes Aura Skills lose their reservations and become a Blessing Skill. You will only be able to benefit from one Blessing at a time and while under the effect of a Supported Skill, all Non-Blessing Skills which reserve mana are disabled. Faster Casting is a support gem that increases the cast speed of linked spells. When linked to a minion skill, Faster Casting increases both the cast speed of the summoning spell, and the speed with which summoned minions cast their own spells. Faster Casting also affects the speed with which totems, traps or mines cast spells, but not the speed of placing totems or laying traps or mines. Trap and mine laying speed is instead affected by Trap and Mine Laying Speed, and totem placement speed by Totem Placement Speed. Faster Casting Support can drop anywhere. Feeding Frenzy Support is a minion support gem. It changes the supported minion behaviour to be aggressive, allowing them to engage on enemies from farther away. Supported minions have a chance to give the owner the Feeding Frenzy buff on hit, which grants a damage and speed bonus to all friendly minions. Feeding Frenzy Support can drop anywhere. Flamewood Support is a support gem that causes totems to trigger Avenging Flame when hit by an enemy, which fires a mortar into the air, dealing fire damage in an area around the target that hit it. Avenging Flame is a triggered fire projectile spell that fires a projectile into the air that falls around the enemy that hit the totem, dealing damage in an area. Additional projectiles create additional damaging areas, allowing for area overlap to hit the same target. Fork is a support gem that causes any projectiles created by the supported skill to fork when they hit an enemy. Fortify is a support gem. It causes supported melee attack skills to Fortify on hit, granting a stackable buff that reduces incoming damage from hits by 1% per stack up to 20 by default.
