Greater Multiple Projectiles (often referred to as GMP) is a support gem that causes any linked projectile skills to fire four more projectiles than they otherwise would. For instance, SparkSparkSpell, Projectile, Duration, LightningLevel: (1-20)Cost: (5-21) ManaCast Time: 0.65 secCritical Strike Chance: 6.00%Effectiveness of Added Damage: 190%Projectile Speed: 420Launches unpredictable sparks that move randomly until they hit an enemy or expire.Deals (1-104) to (28-1983) Lightning DamageBase duration is 2.00 secondsFires (4-8) Projectiles Additional Effects From 1-20% Quality: Fires +(0.1-2) ProjectilesPlace into an item socket of the right colour to gain this skill. Right click to remove from a socket., which normally launches three projectiles, would instead launch seven sparks when supported by this gem. The projectiles fan out in an arc, facing the direction that the skill is aimed. The spread of the arc is controlled by the positioning the mouse cursor. Positioning the cursor close to the character will result in a wide arc, while positioning it at the edges of the screen will result in a narrow arc. This gem has a wider minimum spread angle than Lesser Multiple Projectiles SupportLesser Multiple Projectiles SupportSupport, ProjectileIcon: lLevel: (1-20)Cost & Reservation Multiplier: 130%Requires Level 8Supports projectile skills.Supported Skills deal (15-6)% less Projectile DamageSupported Skills fire 2 additional Projectiles Additional Effects From 1-20% Quality: Supported Skills deal (0.5-10)% increased Projectile DamageThis is a Support Gem. It does not grant a bonus to your character, but to skills in sockets connected to it. Place into an item socket connected to a socket containing the Skill Gem you wish to augment. Right click to remove from a socket.. This gem can be combined with Lesser Multiple Projectiles for a total of 6 additional Projectiles. Ailments: The "less projectile damage" on the gem doesn't decrease the damage of ailments such as poison, bleed and ignite, so gmp can be used safely to increase the number of targets hit. This can be especially useful with poison and skills that hit the same enemy multiple times, like Barrage and Tornado Shot, as they will stack multiple poisons without diminishing their strength. Guardian's Blessing Support is a support gem that makes an aura skill lose its reservation and become a Blessing Skill. You will only be able to benefit from one Blessing at a time. The aura can only be used while you have a supported minion, which takes a percentage of their maximum life as physical damage over time. Blessing: Blessing skills are limited to 1 aura at a time and cannot be used with other blessing skills. The blessing must be activated by casting it while the linked minion is alive. The aura is cast on the character, like other auras. If the minion dies or expires, Guardian's Blessing is turned off and must be re-activated. Hextouch Support is a support gem that causes a linked skill to apply linked hex(es) on hit. Hexes linked to Hextouch cannot be cast directly. Another linked skill that can hit enemies is required to enable the ability to curse enemies. Hexes are applied after the first hit; the first hit will not be affected by debuffs from the applied hex. Skills that hit multiple times will benefit from the hex after the first hit. Damage over time effects applied by a hexing hit (for example, Decay or ignite) will benefit from the hex. Hexes applied by supported skills no longer have an area of effect, as they only affect enemies hit with the skill. Minions, totems, mines, and traps cannot apply hexes linked to Hextouch Support. As Hextouch does not actually trigger the linked hex and instead applies the equivalent hex to an enemy, the player does not spend mana or other resources when the hex is applied. Hextouch is only considered a trigger for the linked hex and not the skill which is applying it (see Trigger). Increased Critical Strikes Support is a support gem. Any skills linked to this gem will have an increased chance of scoring a critical strike. Increased Critical Strikes Support grants both increased percentage chance and added base critical strike chance, which stacks additively with other increased Critical Strike Chance modifiers. The supported skill must have the ability to score a critical strike for this gem to have any effect. For example, linking this gem to a curse will have no effect. Linking Increased Critical Strikes to a skill that creates a minion or remote (totem, trap, mine) will affect its chance to crit if it can already crit (curses, auras and the like being exempt). Inspiration Support is a support gem that lessens the mana cost of linked skills. When the supported skill is used, it grants an Inspiration Charge, which grants more elemental damage and increased critical strike chance to linked skills. You lose all Inspiration Charges after you spend a certain amount of mana. The mod of this gem: Supported Skills have #% less Mana Cost does not affect mana reservation. Supported skills grant you a Inspiration Charge when you spend mana with them, up to 5 charges. These charges last for 10 seconds. If you haven't generated a charge within those 10 seconds, you will lose all Inspiration Charges. Eldritch Battery: If used, the player will not gain inspiration charges until the energy shield pool is depleted and the mana (underneath the protective energy shield front-end/layer) is being spent.[1] This creates a mana counter for all skills linked with Inspiration Support, up to the respective cap. As soon as a skill is used that puts the total mana spent above the threshold, the mana counter is reset to 0 and all Inspiration Charges are removed. Hence lower mana costs result in better usage of Inspiration Charges. For example, if it takes 100 mana to cast a skill, the first 5 casts will average at 50% of the gem's potential and then the next 3 casts will be at 100% potential, while a mana cost of 1 will result in 795 casts at maximum efficiency after the first 5 initial casts. The less mana cost of skills is additive with other sources of less mana costs. The Inspiration Charges grants more elemental damage and increased critical strike chance per Charge to linked skill gems. Inspiration Charges are shared between all skills linked with Inspiration Support. Intensify Support is a support gem which causes the supported spell to have an increased area of effect. Consecutive casts will have less area of effect and deal more area damage per intensity stack. Gaining/Losing Stacks Tips Intensify Support can drop anywhere. Iron Grip is a support gem that grants the supported skill the effects of the Iron Grip keystone, as well as increased projectile damage. This gem causes strength's physical damage bonus to also apply to projectile attacks made with the supported skills. This causes the supported skill to gain 1% increased physical projectile attack per 5 strength. Since this gem applies the same effect as the Iron Grip keystone passive, these effects do not stack. Taking the keystone in addition to using this gem will impart no additional benefits. Iron Grip Support can drop anywhere. Iron Grip Support can be created from the following recipes: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests:

Iron Will is a support gem that causes the supported skill to gain the effects of the Iron Will keystone, as well as increased spell damage. This gem causes strength's physical damage bonus to also apply to spell damage dealt with the supported skills. This causes the supported skill to gain 1% increased spell damage per 5 strength. Note that this applies to all spell damage, not just physical. Since this gem applies the same effect as the Iron Will keystone passive, these effects do not stack. Taking the keystone in addition to using this gem will impart no additional benefits. Iron Will Support can drop anywhere. Iron Will Support can be created from the following recipes: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests:

Item Quantity is a support gem. It increases the quantity of items dropped by monsters killed by the supported skill. This skill gem no longer drops in the game, and can only be obtained by trading for existing ones in the permanent leagues.[1] However, it can be found as a foil in the Legacy league through Reliquary Key.[citation needed] See also: Item Rarity SupportItem Rarity SupportSupportIcon: RLevel: (1-20)Requires Level 31Supports any skill that can kill enemies.(40-59)% increased Rarity of Items Dropped by Enemies Slain from Supported Skills Additional Effects From 1-20% Quality: (0.5-10)% increased Rarity of Items Dropped by Enemies Slain from Supported SkillsThis is a Support Gem. It does not grant a bonus to your character, but to skills in sockets connected to it. Place into an item socket connected to a socket containing the Skill Gem you wish to augment. Right click to remove from a socket. Damage over time: Increased item quantity from this gem applies also to enemies killed by damage over time effects.[2] Containers: The modifier from this gem does not apply to the quantity of items dropped by opening chests, strongboxes, or other containers. Mechanics that have a defined drop count are also unaffected. For example, the number of abyss jewel drops from Abyssal Troves, essences from imprisoned monster, Blight reward chests, etc, are not affected. Boss drop: While this will affect the quantity of items drops from a map boss, it will not affect the boss specific drop quantity. Fragments from guardians and conquerors, boss specific uniques and boss specific currencies are not affected by item quantity. Maps: This gem does not affect the number of maps that drop. When linked with a skill that creates a minion, trap, mine, or totem, the item quantity modifier will apply to kills made by the minion/trap/mine/totem. This includes deaths caused by Minion Instability explosions. Item Quantity Support is drop disabled.

Life Gain on Hit is a support gem. For every hit made using an attack supported by this gem, you will gain the listed amount of life instantly. The life gain is applied for every hit, not every attack - an arrow that pierces three enemies will cause the attacker to gain life for each of the three enemies that is hit. The effect of this gem will stack with other sources of life gain on hit. Life Leech is a support gem. Skills supported by this gem will leech life back to the player, based on how much damage they deal. The leech from this gem works with any damage type. Leech does not function with damage over time effects. Life Leech Support can drop anywhere. Spending a certain amount of life grants the Lifetap buff, which allows skills supported by Lifetap to deal more damage. Mana Leech is a support gem. Attack Skills supported by this gem will leech mana back to the player, based on how much damage they deal. Unlike most sources of mana leech that only count physical damage, the leech from this gem considers all attack damage types when determining how much mana the attacker will gain. However, it will not work on damage over time effects. Mana Leech Support can drop anywhere. Manaforged Arrows is a support gem that triggers a linked bow attack skill when the player spends enough mana on other bow attacks. Supported Skills Trigger once total Mana Spent on other Bow Attacks exceeds 300% of their Mana Cost: tracks cumulative mana spent on all bow attack skills, including ballista totem skills, traps, and mines that use bow skills. "Their" refers to "Supported Skills", not "other Bow Attacks". That is, the threshold is 300% of the mana cost of each supported skill, not 300% of the mana cost of the other bow attacks. Example: Tornado Shot is linked to Manaforged Arrows Support and costs 14 mana. Those 14 mana times 300% are 42 mana, which is the threshold. The other bow skill you are using is barrage (not supported by manaforged arrows support) and costs 6 mana. After attacking for the 7th time (7*6=42) you have reached the threshold and Tornado Shot will trigger. Meat Shield Support is a support gem for minion skills. It changes the minions' behaviour to be defensive, causing them to stay close to their owner and prioritise attacking close enemies by lowering their aggro radius. It also causes the supported minions to take less damage, grants increased movement speed, a chance to taunt on hit, and grants them more damage against enemies near you. Minions are Defensive: If a minion is both Aggressive and Defensive, the effects will cancel each other out. Melee Splash Support is a support gem that can be linked with a melee strike skill gem to add a splash effect to the attack, dealing damage around each enemy struck by it. Melee Splash only supports strike skills and has no interaction with other types of skills like slam skills. It causes the skill to deal damage around the strike target in a greater area than strike skill's default splashing behaviour. The splash damage is considered area melee damage and is not considered as part of the strike itself. The splash is affected by modifiers to area of effect and area damage, but will not affect the strike's damage if it was not originally dealing area damage.[1] The area of effect created by Melee Splash has a base radius of 14 units.[2] Splash can apply on-hit effects; for example, a hit that would knockback the target would also knockback enemies hit by the splash damage. Mirage Archer is a support gem that causes linked bow skills to summon a ghostly archer. When the player hits an enemy with the supported skill, a temporary Mirage Archer is summoned above the player which uses that skill. The Mirage Archer is a distinct entity, and as such, the following apply: Like a Totem, the mirage archer uses your skill and deals your damage, so most effects that apply to nearby allies will have no effect on it. Also like a totem, the archer has its own Action speed and its attack rate is not affected by Chill or Freeze inflicted on the player. Equipping a level 20 Mirage Archer with 0% quality translates to 27.6% more damage: Mirage Archer Support can drop anywhere. Momentum Support is a support gem. When you use the supported attack skill, it grants a stack of Momentum, granting increased attack speed per stack. Momentum is removed when you move while you have it. At five stacks, Momentum is removed to grant the Swiftness buff, which grants increased movement speed. Momentum Support can drop anywhere. Power Charge On Critical Support is a support gem that gives supported skills a chance of granting the player a power charge when they deal a critical strike, as well as more damage per power charge. Although each critical strike has an independent chance to grant a charge, most skills are limited to gaining 1 charge per attack or cast, including repeats.[1] Some skills bypass this limitation, see charge gain. Predator Support is a support gem for minion skills which grants the supported minions more damage. The gem also grants the player the Signal Prey skill, which can be targeted on an enemy to cause minions supported by Predator Support to focus attacking the target and gain more damage with hits and ailments against it. Signal Prey will temporarily override any Aggressive or Defensive minion behaviour during the effect. Predator Support can drop anywhere. It is available in permanent leagues only as a legacy item.

Prismatic Burst Support is a support gem that causes the supported attack skill to release a Prismatic Burst on hit, dealing spell damage of a random chosen element in an area around the enemy. The player's strength, dexterity, and intelligence values determine the likelihood to pick fire, cold, and lightning damage respectively. Restrictions: Supports attacks, causing them to trigger the Prismatic Burst spell. Cannot support triggered attacks or attacks used by things other than you. Cannot modify the skills of minions. Prismatic Burst triggers at the location where the enemy was hit by an attack. Choosing elements: The % chance for Prismatic Burst to choose each specific element is visible in the tooltip for the skill. Conversion: Due to the Deals 100% less Damage of each unchosen Damage Type modifier, converting the skill's damage (such as with Avatar of Fire) will prevent unchosen damage types from adding any damage to the chosen damage type. Additionally, Prismatic Burst will be unable to ignite unless the chosen damage type of the hit is Fire. Additionally, Prismatic Burst cannot deal any Physical or Chaos damage, so modifiers that cause you to gain Elemental or non-Chaos Damage as Chaos Damage have no effect; this skill cannot poison enemies. Prismatic Burst Support can drop anywhere. Rupture is a support gem that supports Attack skills, causing them to inflict a stack of Rupture if they deal a critical strike that also applies bleeding. Rupture is a debuff that causes enemies to take more damage from bleeding, but also causes bleeding to expire more quickly. Per its reminder text, Up to 3 Ruptures can be inflicted on a target, lasting 3 seconds each. Rupture dynamically applies to all bleeding debuffs on the target, even those that are not applied by supported skills. Rupture's effect on expiration rate is effectively multiplicative with effects that cause bleeding to deal damage faster, such as Sadism SupportSadism SupportSupportIcon: XLevel: (1-20)Cost & Reservation Multiplier: 130%Requires Level 18Supports any skill that hits enemies.Damaging Ailments inflicted with Supported Skills deal damage (60-79)% faster80% less Duration of Ailments inflicted with Supported Skills Additional Effects From 1-20% Quality: Supported Skills deal (0.5-10)% increased Damage over TimeThis is a Support Gem. It does not grant a bonus to your character, but to skills in sockets connected to it. Place into an item socket connected to a socket containing the Skill Gem you wish to augment. Right click to remove from a socket..[1] The duration of Rupture is not affected by skill effect duration, as indicated by the lack of Duration gem tag. Rupture Support can drop anywhere. Right click to remove from a socket., Ruthless Blows will not occur from attacks 1-8, but from attacks 9-12. Using this idea, a Ruthless Blow may actually trigger by skill use, rather than skill attack. This means you will have to use the attack skill three times to benefit from a Ruthless Blow. The Ruthless Blow counter still counts whether or not you hit with a skill. For example: if you miss the hits from the first 2 uses of your supported attack, then Ruthless Blow will activate on your next (3rd) use whether it is a hit or not. This extends to Attack Cancelling, if you cancel the animation of your attack before it finishes, the Ruthless Blow counter still counts this and will activate on your third usage of the attack, whether you cancel it or not.

Using this idea, a Ruthless Blow may actually trigger by skill use, rather than skill attack. This means you will have to use the attack skill three times to benefit from a Ruthless Blow. The Ruthless Blow counter still counts whether or not you hit with a skill. For example: if you miss the hits from the first 2 uses of your supported attack, then Ruthless Blow will activate on your next (3rd) use whether it is a hit or not. This extends to Attack Cancelling, if you cancel the animation of your attack before it finishes, the Ruthless Blow counter still counts this and will activate on your third usage of the attack, whether you cancel it or not. It is possible to reset the Ruthless Blow counter to 0 by losing the active skill it supports, for example by resocketing it, or re-equipping the item it's socketed in. (Resocketing Ruthless Support itself does not reset the counter.) Tracking Blows: Keeping track of Ruthless Blows allows for them to be ready to use before a fight begins. This combination prevents sacrificing your life from interrupting life recharge, allows you to recharge 100% of your life per second, and allows you to maximize the amount of life sacrificed each cast as long as you cast less than 5 times per second (you will recharge to full before the next cast). Sources of life recovery rate can be used to push the life recharge even higher, allowing higher cast rates. However, life becoming reserved will interrupt life recharge if the unreserved maximum life becomes lower than your current life.

Sources of life recovery rate can be used to push the life recharge even higher, allowing higher cast rates. However, life becoming reserved will interrupt life recharge if the unreserved maximum life becomes lower than your current life.[2] When life is paid or sacrificed to a skill's cost, your life total after you have paid the spell's cost is used to determine properties of the skill. This means that a character using a skill supported by Sacrifice can gain the benefit of Pain Attunement, or any other similar modifier, if the cost of using that skill brings them to Low Life. Proxy: Totems are the only proxy that can be supported with this gem. Totems will sacrifice their own life when casting and scales with totem life modifiers. Divine Shrine: As Sacrifice Support sacrifices life rather than causing the player to take damage, being affected by a Divine Shrine will not prevent life loss. Sacrifice Support can drop anywhere. Sadism Support is a support gem which causes damaging ailments you inflict to deal damage faster and have less duration. Sadism Support greatly modifies ailment duration. Damaging Ailments inflicted with Supported Skills deal damage #% faster is additive with other modifiers that cause ailments to deal damage faster or slower. To calculate the new ailment duration after supporting it with Sadism Support, use the following formula: Without any other sources of increased ailment duration, damaging ailments have the following modified base durations: Ignite and Bleeding gain more value from Sadism Support, as they cannot normally stack (and when they do, have a maximum stack amount), causing excessive stacks to be wasted. Modifying its duration to be significantly shorter allows greater efficiency of ailments. However, Sadism will also more likely than not result in large dps losses due to several factors, such as the fact "Damaging Ailments inflicted with Supported Skills deal damage faster" is additive to other sources (making it a poor support to begin with) and the fact it will very likely result in uptime losses, as you will need to continuously use your skills in order to inflict several bleeds or ignite per second. As soon as you are not able to do so, the slight dps increase is immediately lost by the fact you are not doing any damage while moving. Poison does not inherently have this issue as there is no maximum limit to poison stacks. However, several mechanics may benefit from having short-duration poisons so they expire before the next application, such as the Poison Mastery and stacking Low Tolerance which care about non-poisoned enemies, and Viper Strike of the MambaViper Strike of the MambaAttack, Duration, Melee, Strike, ChaosLevel: (1-20)Cost: (6-10) ManaAttack Damage: (155-442)% of baseEffectiveness of Added Damage: (155-442)%Hits enemies, converting some of your physical damage to chaos damage and inflicting poison which will be affected by modifiers to skill duration. Spell Echo is a support gem that causes supported spells to repeat. A repeat is part of the original cast. It does not require a cost or a cooldown, normally has the same critical strike roll, and does not cause when you cast effects to occur a second time.[1] Spell Echo can only modify non-instant spells cast by a player or minion. It cannot support skills used by proxies or spells that trigger.[2] Repeats are not reflected in most ingame tooltip information: the time required for both the original cast and the repeat is two times the tooltip value. Stun is a support gem. Skills supported by this gem receive a reduced stun threshold modifier, increasing the chance that they will stun the enemy. Stun Support can drop anywhere. Stun Support can be created from the following recipes: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests: Stun Support was previously known as the "Stun threshold reduction" support gem.

Summon Phantasm Support is a support gem that causes supported skills to summon a phantasm minion upon killing an enemy or hitting a rare or unique enemy. Linking Summon Phantasm Support to an active skill causes it to become a skill that summons minions. This does not add the minion gem tag to the skill gem.[1] It does enable supportability by gems compatible with phantasms—projectile spell-casting minions. Compatible stats may also affect non-minion aspects of the skill. The level of Summon Phantasm Support will always determine the level of the Phantasms.[2] Summoned phantasms have a base cast rate of 0.85, 40% Elemental Resistances, and 20% Chaos Resistance. Multiple skills can be supported by Summon Phantasm Support, but the total number of Phantasms is limited by the highest level support gem. This support gem can support Summon Phantasm, a related skill. Because the skill itself cannot hit or summon non-phantasm minions, it cannot trigger the support gem's effects, but it does add the Maximum # Summoned Phantasm stat to its default maximum phantasms. Due to a bug, Phantasms summoned from minion skills do not inherit minion bonuses from the skill that it's linked to.[3] Summon Phantasm Support is a support gem; it does not summon phantasms, the skill it supports does. If that skill has any minion bonuses, naturally or from other support gems, those bonuses can also apply to phantasms. For example: Note: Summon Phantasm Support is an old support that predates hybrid gems. Its coding is acknowledged as problematic[4] and the above interactions may not be functional. Ingame confirmation is recommended. Summon Phantasm Support can drop anywhere. In addition to other sources of Damage over Time, it now affects damaging Ailments inflicted by supported skills, and reduces their duration. It now grants 25% more Damage over Time for supported skills at gem level 1 (up from 20%) and 44% more Damage over time at gem level 20 (up from 39%). Rapid Decay has been added to the game.

The trap is invisible to enemies, and the first enemy to enter the trap's trigger radius sets off the trap. That enemy is targeted by the linked skill, and the trap is destroyed. A unique item is an item with a specific name, unique artwork, and a predetermined list of modifiers. Unique items usually have the same implicit modifier as a normal item of the same type. Unique items are meant to be less powerful overall than high-level rare items, but offer unique gameplay and allow special character builds to be based around them.[citation needed] Currently there are 1,183 released unique items, including maps and items with modifier variants. For a timeline when each unique item was added, see the timeline of unique items. The following is a non-exhaustive list of ways that unique items can be obtained. Unique items can always be traded. Like all items, unique items can have legacy variants. This means for some uniques there exist better (or worse) versions that aren't dropping anymore in Standard leagues. The main source of legacy items are nerfs that affect future item drops, but leave the already existing items as they were. The only way to get these legacy items is from players who had them before they were changed. Rerolling the item's modifier values with a Divine OrbDivine OrbStack Size: 20Randomises the values of the random modifiers on an itemRight click this item then left click a magic, rare or unique item to apply it. may change a mod's values to match the current version of the unique item, but not for all of them. It will not add or remove modifiers that have been adjusted since then as well. During the Closed Beta phase of Path of Exile's development, supporters of the game that purchased the Diamond supporter pack were given the opportunity to collaborate on the design of a unique item.[4] For a period of time at the start of the Open Beta, Grinding Gear Games offered supporters a unique item design opportunity as a standalone purchase.[5] Once the Open Beta supporter packs were made available, Eternal and Ruler of Wraeclast supporters were likewise also given the opportunity to design a unique item.[6]

Blessed items are upgraded versions of breach items found in Breaches. These items require the use of a corresponding Blessing that drops from Breachlords within their domains. When a Blessing is applied to an item, that item will be permanently imbued with new power and a new name and may change base items. Blessed items cannot randomly drop or be chanced.

Breach items are a kind of unique items found in Breaches. These items can be upgraded by using a corresponding Blessing that drops from Breachlords within their Domains. When the Blessing is used, that item will be permanently imbued with new power and a new name and may change base items. Blessed items cannot randomly drop or chanced.

This article describes historical game content. Originally part of the prophecy system, fated unique items were improved versions of other unique items. Various unique items could be upgraded to their fated forms by fulfilling the prophecy that involved slaying a specific unique monster while holding that item. Once the prophecy was fulfilled, the item would be given a new name and additional stats. Fated unique items started to be phased out in version 3.17.0 and were fully removed in version 3.19.0. Fated unique items were originally part of the prophecy system, first introduced in Prophecy league. A number of prophecies could be fulfilled by defeating a specific unique monster while holding a specific unique item. As a result of fulfilling the prophecy, the unique item would be transformed into its fated form, giving it additional stats, a new name and new flavor text. One such prophecy, From The VoidFrom The VoidThe iron heart, burned in the blackness of the void that lies beyond sight, rots all it touches.You will defeat Bameth while holding Blackheart.Right-click to add this prophecy to your character., required the character to kill Bameth while holding BlackheartBlackheartIron RingAdds 1 to 4 Physical Damage to AttacksAdds (10-15) to (20-25) Chaos Damage to AttacksRegenerate (10-15) Life per second10% chance to Cause Monsters to FleeFear is highly infectious. in order to turn it into VoidheartVoidheartIron RingRequires Level 48Adds 1 to 4 Physical Damage to Attacks5% increased Global Physical DamageAdds (10-15) to (20-25) Chaos Damage to Attacks+(20-30) to maximum LifeRegenerate (10-15) Life per second10% chance to Cause Monsters to FleeMelee Attacks have (30-50)% chance to cause BleedingMelee Attacks have (20-40)% chance to Poison on HitNothing spreads fear faster than the unknown.. The first iteration of the upgrade process required the character to have the unique item equipped as the monster was killed in order to fulfill the prophecy. In version 3.1.0, this restriction was loosened; the player could either equip the item or simply place it in the character's inventory while defeating the monster. In all cases, the prophecy would remain unfulfilled if the unique item was corrupted, or it was an alternate art or foil variant. When a unique item was upgraded into its fated form, its name and flavor text would change, and it would gain (and sometimes lose) one or more modifiers, depending on the item. Apart from that, it would retain all of its original properties. Its appearance, quality value, item level, and base stats would stay the same. The number, color and link configuration of its sockets would remain unchanged, along with any gems placed into those sockets. Any modifiers that carried over to the fated version would keep the same values that they had originally. Over half of them became unobtainable outside of trading with other players in permanent leagues. At the same time, some unique items were reworked to be equivalent or similar to their old fated forms. The fated unique items that remained during the phasing out period formed a special pool of drop-restricted unique items. Replica unique items or replicas are engineered reproductions of existing unique items. They resemble the originals in design, but they come with a particular twist that makes them functionally different. Replicas can be obtained in the Curio Display in the final reward rooms of any Grand Heists. In almost all cases Replicas share the same base type as the original item. Path of Exile contains numerous unique items. Currently there are 1,353 released unique items, including maps and items with modifier variants. Many of these items were designed by players who bought a Diamond support pack during beta testing.

Many unique items can have several variants. These variants can be categorized into several categories, which also affect their generation and method of acquisition. Variants are distinctly different items from each other, so rerolling their modifier values with a Divine OrbDivine OrbStack Size: 20Randomises the values of the random modifiers on an itemRight click this item then left click a magic, rare or unique item to apply it. will never transform them into another variant. It is possible for an item to both have basetype variants and modifier variants. Basetype variants share the same name but have a different base item type. Doryani's Delusion, Precursor's Emblem, and Grand Spectrum are both basetype variants and modifier variants. Synthesised uniques and their fractured or regular (obtained via vendor recipe) versions are also considered basetype variants. Modifier variants generate with distinct combinations of modifiers and cannot change between or reroll into other variants. Lord of Steel and Impresence are distinct in having different art for each variant despite having the same basetype and name. They also have individual slots for each unique item art variant in the Unique Collection Tab; the regular Elder and Uber Uber Elder variants of each damage type variant of Impresence share the same slots, however. Pseudo-variants are sets of items which are distinct and different in name, but are typically treated as variants of the same item.

Absolution is a skill that damages enemies in an area, applying a debuff for a short duration. If a non-unique enemy dies while affected by the debuff, the enemy's corpse will be consumed to summon a friendly Sentinel of Absolution minion for a longer secondary duration, or to refresh the duration and life of an existing one instead if you have the maximum number of them. A Sentinel of Absolution, according to the datamined material, is a reskinned Temple Adjudicator (which itself has another variant Heretical Adjudicator).[1] Absolution can drop anywhere. Absolution of Inspiring is a skill that damages enemies in an area, applying a debuff for a short duration. Alchemist's Mark is a spell that marks a single target with a curse. Hits against the marked target grant flask charges and when you ignite or poison the marked enemy, it leaves behind burning ground or caustic ground under them, respectively. Elemental Proliferation: Ignites that are proliferated from a nearby enemy or corpse to the marked target will not trigger the burning ground. Flask charges: Gain 1 Flask Charge when you Hit a Cursed Enemy grants charges to all flasks.[1] Proxies: hits from proxies, such as totems or traps, are unable to create this curse's ground effects. The duration of the burning and caustic ground are independent of the duration of the ignite or poison that applied it, making it work well with builds that use high-damage, low-duration ignite/poisons. Alchemist's Mark can drop anywhere. Ancestral Call is a support gem. Strike skills that are linked to Ancestral Call will target two additional nearby enemies at the same time, automatically selecting valid targets within range for the attacks. The effect that targets additional nearby enemies can only target enemies outside the strike range of the attacker's own animation. It has a minimum and a maximum range; an enemy cannot be too close or too far from the attacker to be targeted.[1] The base maximum appears to be approximately 3.5 metres, and can be increased by this support's gem quality and the anoint-only Sione's Ambition. The targeting range is unrelated to weapon range or melee strike range. The 'Ancestors' summoned at targeted enemies are client-side visual effects, not separate entities. Effects like damage reflection and leech will apply to the player normally.[2][3] When an additional nearby enemy is targeted, the strike against them can also hit other enemies (typically behind the target), depending on the skill's weapon range. While strike range is normally small, it can be raised through modifiers, which some skills may have by default (e.g. Frost Blades of KatabasisFrost Blades of KatabasisAttack, Melee, Strike, Cold, AoE, DurationLevel: (1-20)Cost: (6-10) ManaAttack Damage: (143-409)% of baseEffectiveness of Added Damage: (143-409)%Attack enemies with greatly increased range, creating a chilling area that deals cold damage over time if it hits. Animate Guardian is a spell, animating weapons and armour on the ground to form an allied minion. Using this skill on an identified item on the ground creates an Animated Guardian that moves and attacks similar to a zombie. Similar to Spectres and unlike other minions, a Guardian stays with you even after logging off and on. If you unequip the skill gem, the Guardian disappears until you equip the gem again, at which point the same Guardian (retaining all its equipment) reappears after casting the spell again. This also holds true when swapping a different AG gem in. Socketing the gem in a weapon or shield slot allows you to recall the Guardian at will by switching weapon sets (default hotkey: X). You can only have one Guardian at a time. It can be equipped with a helmet, body armour, pair of gloves, pair of boots, a shield, and melee weapons. Ranged weapons cannot be animated, similar to Animate WeaponAnimate WeaponDuration, Minion, Spell, PhysicalLevel: (1-20)Cost: (4-16) ManaCast Time: 0.60 secRequires Level 4Animates a Melee Weapon Item or Lingering Blade to fight by your side. You cannot animate unidentified Weapons. Will not animate weapons with 6 sockets. Cannot be used by Traps or Mines.Base duration is 40.00 secondsCan use Items requiring up to Level (9-100)Minions' Attacks deal (5-126) to (8-184) additional Physical DamageAnimated Lingering Blades deal (1-17) to (2-80) Added Attack Physical DamageMinions deal (0-38)% more DamageMaximum (5-14) Animated WeaponsMinions have (0-38)% more Attack Speed Additional Effects From 1-20% Quality: +(0.1-2) to maximum number of Animated WeaponsPlace into an item socket of the right colour to gain this skill. Right click to remove from a socket.. Items can be of any rarity, but must be identified and on the ground to be used. Animated items are consumed by the spell and cannot be recovered. Items containing skill gems cannot be animated, so the Guardian cannot use trigger gems. Items that have modifiers like +x to Maximum life or +x% increased Attack Speed, and even corrupted implicits, apply to the Guardian the same way they apply to player characters; so animating magic or rare equipment can potentially give you a very powerful minion. Unique items can also be used, giving guardians powerful abilities not found elsewhere in the game. Be careful when using valuable items—anything you give to your guardian is gone forever. All modifiers on the items themselves apply to the Animated Guardian once animated, including enchantments, corrupted implicit modifiers, Scourge modifiers, and Crucible passive trees (except modifiers which allocate player notable passive skills, as minions do not have access to your passive tree). The Guardian uses weapons and shields in the same way as player characters, and can dual wield if two one-handed weapons are animated. If you animate an item type that the Guardian is already using (such as a helmet), the new item will overwrite the old one. Equipping an armour piece restores 25% of its life; equipping one-handed weapons or shields will alternate between left and right hand. You cannot equip two shields. The Guardian does not share your max amount of curses you can apply to enemies, and therefore functions as a player with the default curse limit when applying curses (through corrupted gloves, for example). Items: The Guardian's items are tied to the character that summoned it, rather than the gem itself. The gem can freely be changed around without risking loss of the Animate Guardian's equipment. Note that the skill's gem level determines the maximum level requirement of items the Animate Guardian can equip; if the gem's level is too low for an equipped item, it will disable the item temporarily until it is high enough gem level. This does not delete the equipped item. Necromantic Aegis: While using Necromantic Aegis your Guardian benefits from its own shield as well as the one you have equipped, allowing it to gain the benefit of two shields at once. Some unique shields can be quite powerful when doubled up this way.[1] Player versus Player: Animated Guardians killed in PvP areas will not lose their items. This does not apply to Hall of GrandmastersHall of GrandmastersPromenade MapMap Level: 73Map Tier: 6Guild Character: ÙContains the Immortalised GrandmastersPvP damage scaling in effectThe grandest and greatest ever to fight,Divine the champions stand tall.But match their power, best their might,And even the immortal may fall.Travel to this Map by using it in a personal Map Device. Maps can only be used once., even though the map says "PvP damage scaling in effect". In fact, not only is it possible to lose the Guardian's items here, but death is very likely because of the way PvP damage scaling works. Minor enemies can instantly kill a Guardian with 50000+ life in this map, so it is highly recommended to despawn your Guardian before attempting. Item-Granted Skills: Animated Guardians cannot use skills granted by items. Equipping items like Death's Oath, The Rippling Thoughts, or Bubonic Trail will not allow the Guardian to use their associated triggered skills. Effects that apply to nearby allies or enemies, like Leer Cast, or Dying Breath, will apply as normal. Abyssal Sockets: Animated Guardians cannot benefit from abyss jewel modifiers or other socketed items. Equipping items like Tombfist or Bubonic Trail with abyss jewel(s) socketed will not grant their modifiers to a Guardian. This section needs cleanup to meet quality standards. Section should be more concise, wording could be improved, could be moved to a Guide namespace Please help improve this section if you can. Life regeneration and percentage increases to life are especially potent on an Animated Guardian because of its huge innate life pool. Resistances should also be capped to improve survivability (a Guardian has 40% base elemental resistances and 20% chaos resistance). The stats displayed in the skill's tooltip only accounts for modifiers the skill has, like from the passive tree, jewels, player-equipped items and support gems. It cannot account for further modifiers from things like being affected by an aura, shields through Necromantic Aegis or modifiers from items an Animated Guardian has equipped. These will not factor into the skill's tooltip but are active nonetheless.[2] Note that Kaom's HeartKaom's HeartGlorious PlateArmour: (776-892)Requires Level 68, 191 StrHas no Sockets+1000 to maximum LifeThe warrior whofears will fall. and similar items with +# to maximum Life are of less benefit due to Animated Guardian's very high inherent Life.

If the "Key Pickup" option is enabled in the UI tab of the Options menu, the "Highlight items and objects" key may be held in order to animate specific weapons. Otherwise, the skill will attempt to animate a random valid weapon within a small area around the player's cursor. Attempting to animate a weapon with a level requirement higher than the maximum listed on the gem will cost mana and perform the cast animation, but will fail to create a minion. Right click to remove from a socket.. Animated Weapons are minions that are considered to be using the original weapon animated. They are therefore affected by modifiers to minions, as well as support gems for weapons, such as Elemental Damage with Attacks SupportElemental Damage with Attacks SupportAttack, SupportIcon: WLevel: (1-20)Cost & Reservation Multiplier: 130%Requires Level 18Supports attack skills.Supported Attack Skills deal (20-34)% more Elemental Damage Additional Effects From 1-20% Quality: (0.5-10)% increased Elemental Damage with Attack SkillsThis is a Support Gem. It does not grant a bonus to your character, but to skills in sockets connected to it. Place into an item socket connected to a socket containing the Skill Gem you wish to augment. Right click to remove from a socket., but not affected by any of the player's passive tree for specific weapons. All modifiers on the weapon item itself apply to the minions once animated, including enchantments, corrupted implicit modifiers, Scourge modifiers, and Crucible passive trees (except modifiers which allocate player notable passive skills, as minions do not have access to your passive tree). There are different calculations for weapons summoned from items on the ground and lingering blades from spells. Weapons inherit the hit damage, attack speed and critical strike chance of the weapon they are summoned from. This includes any direct modifiers to base stats, such as 108% increased Physical Damage, which are factored into the base damage of the minion. The minion then gains additional Physical damage based on gem level, which is not scaled by weapon local modifiers. The additional damage for Lingering Blades does not apply to animated itemized weapons.

Armageddon Brand is a spell that creates a brand at the target position. While attached, the brands creates fiery meteors that land on the target's location and deal fire damage in an area. Maximum Active Brands: All brands share a limit of three (3) active brand limit. This can be split between the two brand skills (2-1) or all of one type. Passive skills can increase the number of active brands that are allowed to be active at a time. Maximum Brand Attachment: By default, you may only have one brand of any kind attached to a single target at any time. Taking the Keystone Runebinder allows you to place a second brand on a single target. Like the Active Brand limit these brands may either be split (1-1) or both the same type of brand. Right click to remove from a socket. so far as repeating the initial cast of the brand. The more casting speed multiplier on spell echo does NOT however affect the activation speed of the brand once attached to a target. Meteor: When Armageddon Brand activates, it casts a meteor falling down on the attached enemy. However, this meteor has a slow travel time, so if the enemy is fast-moving, the meteor can miss the enemy entirely. This also affects the "smoothness" of the skill, as this meteor drop delay time cannot be overcome. The meteor deals damage in an area on impact, this area is affected by modifiers to AoE. Ignite: When scaling Ignite, it is not recommended to take Runebinder unless player tries to maximize ignite uptime while using Sadism Support, since having multiple brands attached to an enemy does not increase the Ignite damage taken by the enemy (since there can only be one active Ignite instance on the enemy). The only benefit from the keystone would be higher hit frequency on the enemy which would potentially cause a bigger Ignite (from a bigger hit) to be applied. Armageddon Brand can drop anywhere. Autoexertion is a skill gem that reserves mana for each supported warcry skill to have them trigger automatically once off cooldown. Supported warcries no longer grant buffs or charges, but can still exert attacks and debuff enemies. When linked to Autoexertion, all supported warcries each have a base reservation of 15%. This can be modified by modifiers to reservation efficiency. These modified reservations are then added together, and the sum is used as a single reservation for Autoexertion. This value cannot be further modified, as reservation efficiency is already applied. Autoexertion does not cause warcries to share a cooldown; each warcry will automatically trigger at the end of their cooldowns. Triggering a warcry does not count as 'using' a warcry for when you use a Warcry, but it does count as warcrying for when you Warcry effects (e.g. Lead By Example, gain 5 Valour when you Warcry, if able Banner Mastery), and also as having Warcried Recently (e.g. Admonisher or DeidbellowDeidbellowGilded SalletArmour: (290-397)Evasion: (90-97)Requires Level 33, 38 Str, 38 Dex+(20-30) to Strength+(20-30) to DexterityAdds 10 to 20 Physical Damage to Attacks+(200-300) to Armour20% increased Melee DamageCannot Leech when on Low LifeIf you've Warcried Recently, you and nearby allies have 20% increased Attack, Cast and Movement SpeedMay it echo through the halls.).[1] When warcries are triggered through Autoexertion, each warcry's base mana cost is overwritten to 10 instead of the value on the warcry gem. Autoexertion does not trigger skills in hideouts. Autoexertion can drop anywhere. Blade Flurry is a channeling melee attack. While channeling, Blade Flurry repeatedly attacks a random enemy in front of the player, also damaging enemies nearby the original target. When released, it will unleash an extra number of attacks equal to the stage reached. BF produces highest dps when player channels to max stages and then releases immediately. Calculations are for the perfect channeling, actual damage will be a bit lower. Calculating ideal dps: For 21 lvl gem : For 21 lvl gem with +1 max stage enchant: Current assumption is that strike calculates damage before updating stage bonus. So fist strike has 0 stage bonus, and n strike has n-1 stage bonus up to max. Release strikes happen after stage bonus has been updated, so they fully benefit from current stage bonus. It is corroborated by Zrevnur's DPS test in the VERY OLD patch. "Blade Flurry vs Reave: 2.86x damage vs single target" N \color [rgb]{0.6392156862745098,0.5529411764705883,0.42745098039215684}N is number of channel ticks, which is less or equal to max stages. S \color [rgb]{0.6392156862745098,0.5529411764705883,0.42745098039215684}S is number of stages before release, which is less or equal to max stages. Sum of multipliers from stages build up: Damage from release on current stages: Calculating average damage multiplier per channel tick with perfect release: For 6 max stages and 6 ticks: For 7 max stages(helm enchant) and 7 ticks: Blade Flurry can drop anywhere. Note also that Intensity updates on each cast[1], and stats that apply per hit instead of per cast do not snapshot. Visual effect: Blade vortex's visual effect does not scale with Area of effect modifiers. Instead, to give a rough indication of radius, there are several versions of the knife effect, each rotating at a different radius. The skill will always try to have one knife using the largest-radius effect that's not larger than the actual radius of the skill, but that skill results in discrete visual changes where you need to reach a certain threshold before the next wider effect can be used. The full radius is always used mechanically.[2] Blade Vortex's in-game tooltip DPS gives the average damage of one hit from one Blade Vortex instance, multiplied by casts per second. This value is misleading primarily because Blade Vortex can hit more than once over its duration, thus cast speed must not be used, but hits per second (rounds per second, spin rate), over the duration of the stacks. Base spin rate of Blade Vortex is 600 ms. Blade Vortex hit more frequently with more stacks it has. As gem says: 35% increased Hit Rate for each blade.

Bladestorm is a melee attack skill that creates a bladestorm that continuously deals damage in an area for a short duration. Its properties change depending on whether the user is in Blood Stance or Sand Stance. Bladestorm has two components: an initial melee attack that deals damage around the player, and a lingering blood or stand storm that will repeatedly (based on attack speed) deal 50% of melee damage to enemies within its area. This skill interacts with Blood and Sand Stance: In either stance, Bladestorm will have more attack speed while inside a blood bladestorm. While the storms have 100% chance to inflict blind or bleeding, the initial hit does not.[1] The storms generated by the initial melee attack will wait for the duration of the attack time to start dealing damage, e.g. if you have an attack time of 0.5 seconds, the storm will start dealing damage after 0.5 seconds. Blessed items are upgraded versions of breach items found in Breaches. These items require the use of a corresponding Blessing that drops from Breachlords within their domains. When a Blessing is applied to an item, that item will be permanently imbued with new power and a new name and may change base items. Blessed items cannot randomly drop or be chanced.

Blind is a support gem that provides supported skills with a chance to inflict blind, which greatly reduces an enemy's chance to hit for a short duration. Spells do not have a chance to hit (spell always hit and does not take evasion and accuracy into calculation) , the ability to hit with a spell is unaffected by being blinded. Thus, using this support against monster that use spell did not have any effect. Some unique items still provide additional damage against blinded monsters. An attacker's chance to hit with attack skill, is the direct opposite of the defender's chance to evade. Since player characters with Unwavering Stance cannot evade, attacks made against them always hit. As a result, even blinded monster will always have 100% chance to hit a player character with Unwavering Stance (if assuming zero dodge), since the Unwavering Stance character always has 0% chance to evade. Similarly, attacks made by characters with Resolute Technique cannot be evaded, so blind has no effect beyond the sight radius reduction. This also applies to attack that have the mod Hits can't be Evaded during PVP. Blink Arrow is an attack that fires an arrow, upon reaching the destination you are teleported there and a clone is summoned at your previous location. The clone is a minion that uses your bow and quiver. The skill happens in four stages: The length of the first stage is affected by anything that affects regular attacks - weapon base speed, attack speed modifiers etc. The length of the second stage is affected both by bonuses to projectile speed and by global bonuses to attack speed, but not by the weapon's base speed[2][3]. The delay is unaffected by distance travelled. Block Chance Reduction is a support gem. It reduces the target's chance to block attack or spell damage from the supported skills. If the enemy blocks the supported skill, it inflicts overpowered which further reduces the enemies' chance to block. It is a recipe-only support gem intended to have a player-versus-player focus. Skills supported by this gem apply a stacking debuff called Overpowered. Blood Rage applies a buff that deals physical damage to the player over time, while increasing attack speed and life leech. Killing an enemy while this buff is active refreshes the buff duration, and has a chance to grant a frenzy charge. Physical damage reduction: Damage dealt by Blood Rage is lowered by physical damage reduction. Note that armour only reduces physical damage from hits, and thus does not affect the damage taken from Blood Rage. Much like Righteous Fire the damage from this skill does not count as a hit so does not trigger Cast when Damage Taken. Bloodthirst Support is a support gem that grants more damage to attacks made with the supported skill. It also grants added flat physical damage with weapons based on your maximum life pool to the skill while on low life. Bloodthirst's more damage modifier is active unconditionally, whether the character is on low life or not. The flat added physical damage is a conditional modifier, because it is only active while on low life and using a weapon. Damage Calculations The total damage depends on the characters maximum life and total flat damage from other sources. These calculations count both the flat physical damage and the more damage. Therefore they assume the character is on low life and using a weapon. Add up all flat sources of damage not from the gem = Q (Total life X .02) = Y ( Q + Y ) = K ( K X More damage) = V (V / Q) = final answer. Colours indicate scenarios where Level 20 Melee Physical Damage Support or Level 5 Awakened Melee Physical Damage Support would be more beneficial. Bloodthirst Support can drop anywhere. Bodyswap is a spell skill. The skill can target an enemy or a corpse, exploding your body and teleporting you to the target. The skill creates an area of effect explosion that deals fire damage, which scales with your maximum life. When targeting a corpse, it deals more damage and the corpse also explodes to deal damage relative to the corpse's maximum life. Bodyswap can drop anywhere. Bodyswap can be created from the following recipes: This item is given as a quest reward for the following quests: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests: This item cannot be obtained in leagues with Ruthless mode enabled. The following helmet enchantments affect Bodyswap. Note that helmet enchantments are no longer obtainable since version 3.23.0 and can only be obtained in permanent leagues as already enchanted items from before this patch.

Bodyswap of Sacrifice is a transfigured spell skill. The skill can target an enemy or a minion, exploding your body and teleporting you to the target. The skill creates an area of effect explosion that deals fire damage, which scales with your maximum life. When targeting a minion, it deals more damage, the minion explodes and is destroyed to deal damage relative to its maximum life. Bone Offering is an offering spell that consumes one or more corpses, temporarily granting the player's minions a chance to block attacks and spells, and life regeneration if they have blocked recently. The skill consumes a corpse and up to 4 additional corpses around it. Each additional corpse extends the base duration of the skill by 1 second, making the maximum achievable base duration 9 seconds. Each player may only have one offering active at any time. Casting an Offering skill while one is already active will cancel the older one. Bone Offering can drop anywhere. Bonechill Support is a support gem that grants the supported skill more cold damage and increased chill effect. Chills from supported skills also cause enemies to take increased cold damage (from all sources) equal to the strongest chill affecting them. Bonechill Support adds the increase Cold Damage taken by Chill Effect stat to chill debuffs from supported skills, as well as to chilling areas created by them. This is a boolean property, and accordingly does not stack when enemies are both chilled by a skill and inside that skill's chilling area.[1] Chill Effect refers to the enemy's strongest #% reduced Action Speed from any chill. This does not need to be applied by the same chill debuff: one chill can apply Bonechill, and another chill can apply the strongest action speed reduction.[2] This means the player can choose to support a secondary skill with Bonechill (e.g. FrostblinkFrostblinkSpell, Movement, Duration, Cold, Travel, Blink, AoELevel: (1-20)Cost: (12-22) ManaCooldown Time: (3.00 sec-2.60 sec)Can Store 1 Use(s)Cast Time: InstantCritical Strike Chance: 5.00%Effectiveness of Added Damage: (180-250)%Requires Level 4Teleport to a location, damaging enemies and leaving Chilled ground in an area at both ends of the teleport. Right click to remove from a socket.) to make enemies take increased cold damage from a primary skill with different support gems. Because Bonechill's increased cold damage taken is applied by chill and based on chill effect, it is normally capped to 30%, has no effect on enemies Unaffected by Chill,[3] and will affect the player when their chill is reflected (e.g. by Non-Damaging Ailments you inflict are reflected back to you). Freeze is unrelated to Bonechill, though hits that freeze typically also have enough cold damage to chill.[4] Bonechill Support can drop anywhere. Brand Recall is a spell that recalls all brands to the caster and causes them to activate. Brand Recall can only reach level 6 through regular experience gain, but the required experience to reach level 6 is comparable to that of regular gems. Its level cap can be exceeded the same way as other gems. Activations caused by Brand Recall cannot benefit from against Branded Enemy stats, even if the brand immediately attaches to an enemy. Spends 20% of Brand's Cost is a cost for effects that interact with costs, like Eldritch Battery or Tawhanuku's TimingTawhanuku's TimingMoonstone RingRequires Level 44+(15-25) to maximum Energy Shield(30-40)% increased Spell Damage+(60-80) to maximum Mana(5-10)% chance to Freeze, Shock and IgniteSpells cause you to gain Energy Shield equal to their UpfrontCost every fifth time you Pay itThe soul still beats, even when the heart never did. or stats that count total resource spent. It is not directly affected by cost modifiers (as the modifiers would already apply to the brand's cost, to prevent double-dipping). If the cost of the recalled brands changes, the cost spent by Brand Recall updates to match it. Insufficient mana or life does not prevent the brands from being recalled. Because Brand Recall's natural cooldown is 4 seconds, socketing Brand Recall in a Trigger a Socketed Spell when you Use a Skill, with a 8 second Cooldown weapon replaces its natural cooldown with the longer veiled cooldown. Breach items are a kind of unique items found in Breaches. These items can be upgraded by using a corresponding Blessing that drops from Breachlords within their Domains. When the Blessing is used, that item will be permanently imbued with new power and a new name and may change base items. Blessed items cannot randomly drop or chanced.

Brutality Support is a support gem that grants more physical damage while losing the ability to deal elemental and chaos damage. The Awakened version of this gem, Awakened Brutality Support can be found in maps. Because Brutality Support prevents non-physical damage, it also prevents poisoning with supported skills, as 0 DPS poisons are never applied. Brutality Support can drop anywhere. Cast on Critical Strike (commonly referred to as CoC) is a support gem that causes linked spells to trigger when the player critically strikes with a linked attack skill. If more than one spell is supported by Cast on Critical Support, the order of the triggered spells will follow the trigger order. (Successive triggers cycle through all valid supported spells in the same order.) Each supported skill has its own cooldown, except multiple copies of the same spell, which share their cooldown. Due to how server frames are calculated, there are breakpoints of cooldown recovery rates required to achieve a higher effective trigger rate.[1]. Additional cooldown reduction that does not reach the next threshold is wasted. The attack rates below are maximums; exceeding the attack rates even slightly can significantly reduce proc rate due to skipping procs while the skill is still on cooldown. It is better to be slightly below the attack rate than above it. Note that multiples of the attack rate also work (e.g. 12.12 APS will proc at the same rate as 6.06 APS). Cast On Critical Strike Support can drop anywhere. Cast on Death is a support gem. It causes linked spells to trigger when the player is killed. Note that this does not trigger on minion deaths. Cast on Death Support can drop anywhere. Cast on Death Support can be created from the following recipes: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests: Cast on Death effect support all skill gems in sockets:

Cast on Melee Kill is a support gem. It causes linked spells to trigger when the player kills an enemy with the melee attack portion of a supported melee skill. Melee Kill: Spells can only be triggered by kills with melee attack damage. Enemies killed by damage over time (e.g. Bleeding applied by a melee hit) will not trigger supported spells.[1] Trigger gem: Cast on Melee Kill has default behaviour, see cooldown and trigger. Cast on Melee Kill Support can drop anywhere. Cast on Melee Kill Support can be created from the following recipes: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests: The following unique items are related to Cast on Melee Kill Support:

Cast when Damage Taken is a support gem. It causes a linked spell to trigger when the player takes a certain amount of damage from hits. Trigger gem: Cast when Damage Taken supports spells. Multiple different spells can be supported, and each will have their own damage taken counter and cooldown. Multiple copies of Cast when Damage Taken will also function independently, as long as they don't support copies of the same active skill, which would cause a shared cooldown. Because spells will only be triggered after the damage is taken, Cast when Damage Taken linked to a guard skill will never save the player from a killing blow; the character will die before the spell is triggered. Damage counter and trigger cooldown: The Cast when Damage Taken gem itself does not have a counter or cooldown, only spells it supports do.[1] Each supported skill has an internal damage counter that tracks the total accumulated damage taken from hits. Damage over time and non-damage loss do not contribute to this counter, i.e. you cannot use Righteous FireRighteous FireSpell, AoE, FireLevel: (1-20)Cooldown Time: 0.30 secCan Store 1 Use(s)Cast Time: InstantRequires Level 16Engulfs you in magical fire that rapidly burns you and nearby enemies. Your spell damage is substantially increased while under this effect. The effect ends when you have 1 life remaining.Deals 70% of your Maximum Life as Base Fire Damage per secondDeals 70% of your Maximum Energy Shield as Base Fire Damage per secondYou Burn for 90% of your Maximum Life per second as Fire DamageYou Burn for 70% of your Maximum Energy Shield per second as Fire DamageGrants (20-39)% more Spell DamageBase radius is (1.8-2.3) metres Additional Effects From 1-20% Quality: Base radius is (0.015-0.3) metresPlace into an item socket of the right colour to gain this skill. Right click to remove from a socket. to trigger Cast when Damage Taken.[2] All damage counters will be reset to 0 upon entering a new area. A skill does not track damage taken while it is on cooldown. If the damage threshold is met but the skill cannot trigger (e.g. due to insufficient mana), the damage counter resets. Skill cooldowns: Because skills can only have one cooldown, Cast when Damage Taken does not add its 0.25s cooldown to skills that already have a cooldown that's equal or higher. Maximum level of supported skills: Cast when Damage Taken cannot support skills with a higher level requirement than that of Cast when Damage Taken itself. This restriction only applies to skill gems; support gems are not affected. Trigger order: If multiple triggers proc simultaneously, skills triggered follow a set order. Targeting: Triggered spells will target the location of the entity that dealt the hit that caused the trigger. Reflected damage is considered to come from the enemy which the damage was reflected from. If triggered by self-damage, it will target a random enemy, or if there are no enemies, it will target the player's location or a random direction, depending on the triggered skill.[3][4] Cast when Damage Taken Support can drop anywhere. Cast when Damage Taken Support can be created from the following recipes: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests: The following unique items are related to Cast when Damage Taken Support: Cast when Damage Taken Support has the following alternate skill effects: Cats when Damage Taken was a trigger gem available only on April 1, 2015 as an April Fool's joke.[5] Like Cast when Damage Taken, it caused a linked spell to activate when the player accumulated damage taken, but besides casting the spell, it also summoned black cats. Other properties were identical to the Cast when Damage Taken skill.

Cast when Stunned is a support gem that grants supported spells a chance to trigger when the player is stunned or blocks a stunning hit. Different spells supported by Cast when Stunned are independent: when the character is stunned or blocks a stunning hit, each supported spell rolls its own chance to trigger, and each spell that succeeds its chance check will trigger and go on its own cooldown. Because multiple copies of the same spell (or a transfigured variant) with the same trigger share a cooldown, supporting duplicate spells with Cast when Stunned will only result in two chance rolls, never two triggers. Triggered spells will target the location of the enemy that stunned the player. Chance to Flee Support is a support gem that grants supported skills a chance to cause monsters to flee when they are hit by those skills. Enemies hit by the supported skill will have a Chance to Flee; they will attempt to run to a random point somewhere away from the character until they reach a certain point, are interrupted, or are unable to reach their selected point and give up. If a fleeing enemy becomes stunned, their fleeing behaviour will be interrupted. Magic monsters have a 50% chance to avoid fleeing for any reason, and rare monsters are immune to this gem's effects. Some monsters naturally flee when they are burning. This includes apes, humanoids and sea witches. This support gem has limited usage, as groups of normal and magic monsters are usually not dangerous enough to threaten a character. Causing a monster to flee often increases the amount of effort required to kill them, as packs can scatter in different directions lowering the efficiency of attacks and spells that target an area. The gem may benefit characters using the far Shot keyword, or characters who cause bleeding and want to ensure weak targets still take the increased damage rate caused by movement. Characters using bows and seeking increased bleeding damage might be better served by the Ensnaring Arrow skill gem. Chance to Flee Support can drop anywhere. Close Combat Support is a support gem which grants the supported attack more melee damage based on how close the user is to the enemy. It also causes the skill to grant Combat Rush on hit, a buff which grants the next travel skill used within 2 seconds more attack speed. This support gem restricts the skill to swords and axes. The "up to x% more damage" stat on Close Combat support (and the matching stat on the Slayer's Impact notable) applies the full damage bonus to targets up to a distance of 1.5 metres from you, then linearly scales down the bonus to 0 at a distance of 4 metres.[1] Close Combat appears to be a buff, scaling with IchimonjiIchimonjiCorsair SwordOne Handed SwordPhysical Damage: (45-58.5) to (167.4-195)Critical Strike Chance: 5.00%Attacks per Second: (1.86-1.94)Weapon Range: 1.1 metresRequires Level 58, 81 Str, 117 Dex40% increased Global Accuracy Rating(80-95)% increased Physical DamageAdds (5-10) to (13-20) Physical Damage(20-25)% increased Attack Speed10% increased Effect of Buffs on you10% increased Mana Reservation Efficiency of SkillsAllies' Aura Buffs do not affect youYour Aura Buffs do not affect alliesMaster yourself before you seek to master others., but lacks the typical green-bordered icon. Cluster Traps is a support gem that changes the laying behaviour of any supported traps. Instead of throwing a single trap, three traps are thrown at once, but these traps will be placed randomly in a radius around the targeted location and do less damage than normal. The maximum number of traps of the linked skill is also increased by five. Multiple traps - When a trap skill is supported by Multiple Traps SupportMultiple Traps SupportSupport, TrapIcon: tLevel: (1-20)Cost & Reservation Multiplier: 140%Requires Level 8Supports traps skills, making them throw extra traps in a line.Supported Skills throw up to 2 additional TrapsSupported Skills deal (58-52)% less DamageSupported Skills can have up to 3 additional Traps placed at a time Additional Effects From 1-20% Quality: Supported Skills have (1-20)% increased Trap Trigger Area of EffectThis is a Support Gem. It does not grant a bonus to your character, but to skills in sockets connected to it. Place into an item socket connected to a socket containing the Skill Gem you wish to augment. Right click to remove from a socket. and Cluster Traps, the resulting trap spread will throw a total of 5 traps in the same random spread as Cluster Trap alone. Throwing function - Cluster Trap skills can be thrown to locations of different heights, across gaps, and, unlike Multiple Traps Support, do not have a minimum throwing range. When paired with Multiple Traps, the rules for trap placement follow Cluster Trap's throwing patterns. Cluster radius - Traps thrown with Cluster Trap will always land within 20 units of the targeted enemy or location. Notably, this means with enough % increased Trap Trigger Area of Effect it is possible to increase your traps' trigger radius enough that they will always trigger against a stationary target. For standard sized enemies (radius of 2 units), this is achieved with a trap trigger radius of 18, a total of 224% increased Trap Trigger Area of Effect. Cold Snap is a spell that deals cold damage to enemies in an area, leaving chilled ground that expands and deals cold damage over time. It has a cooldown that can be bypassed with Frenzy Charges. It also has a 25% chance to grant a frenzy charge when you kill an enemy within its area of effect. Modifiers to Spell Damage apply to this Skill's Damage Over Time effect: this modifier allows spell damage modifiers to modify the skill's natural cold damage over time. It will not apply to other types of damage over time, such as Ignite. Chilled Ground: Cold Snap creates an expanding chilled ground that causes enemies to be chilled. While its base effect will scale with the player or skill's modifiers to cold and non-damaging ailments, it is not considered a chill inflicted by the player, limiting the use of certain stats. (See chilling area.) Trigger: Even if the appropriate charges are available, Cold Snap's cooldown cannot be bypassed when triggered.[1] Cold Snap can drop anywhere. Combustion is a support gem that grants supported skills that grants more fire damage and chance to ignite the enemy. Enemies ignited by the supported skill have reduced fire resistance for the duration of the ignite applying Combustion. Note that even though this skill 'Supports any skill that hits enemies', by default only fire damage can ignite. Therefore it by default only helps skills dealing fire damage, see more on ignite, including uniques that enable other elements to ignite. The fire damage could be supplied by gear or for minions for instance a jewel with 'Minions deal additional Fire Damage'. The Chance to Ignite an enemy given by this gem is independent of the chance to ignite an enemy as a result of a critical strike. The overall probability that an enemy will be ignited is: ChanceToIgnite = 1 − ( 1 − SkillCritChance ) ∗ ( 1 − SkillIgniteChance ) \color [rgb]{0.6392156862745098,0.5529411764705883,0.42745098039215684}{\text{ChanceToIgnite}}=1-(1-{\text{SkillCritChance}})*(1-{\text{SkillIgniteChance}}) It is worth noting that as opposed to chance to critical strike, which is checked once for each cast of the skill, the chance to ignite is checked separately for each individual hit. For example, a hit from Consecrated PathConsecrated PathFire, Attack, AoE, Movement, Duration, Slam, MeleeLevel: (1-20)Cost: (9-13) ManaAttack Speed: 80% of baseAttack Damage: (227-417)% of baseEffectiveness of Added Damage: (227-417)%Requires Level 28Slams the ground at a targeted location. If an enemy is near where you target, you'll teleport to it from a short distance away, slam, and create an area of consecrated ground. Controlled Blaze is a support gem that causes melee attacks to have an increased chance to ignite and for each Ignite inflicted with the Skill recently, it deals less Damage but more Ignite Damage. Controlled Blaze will count all hits that have applied ignite, for each monster that received an ignite and any ignite that has been re-applied to an already ignited enemy. Due to the fact that more and less modifiers are multiplicative, Controlled Blaze will provide less DPS at high number of ignites applied recently. Depending on the gem level, the number of ignites you need to inflict to reach its highest damage bonus is 12 or 13.[2] This results in a "sweet spot" of 3 to 3.25 attacks per second (assuming no other targets); however, it is better to exceed this value to account for time not spent attacking while dodging/repositioning. That said, in general, you can be about 4 ignites off from the optimal range before you start experiencing a >5% ignite DPS loss. Controlled Blaze Support can drop anywhere. Controlled Blaze Support can be created from the following recipes: This item is given as a quest reward for the following quests: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests:

Conversion Trap throws a trap that causes the enemy that triggered it to temporarily become allies with the user. Most normal, magic, and rare rarity monsters can be converted into temporary allies using this skill, but unique monsters cannot. Magic and rare monsters that are converted keep all of their monster modifier effects, including aura like effects. Converted monsters also retain all buffs and debuffs that were present on the monster prior to conversion. Duration: Modifiers to skill duration affect the duration of enemy's conversion state. Modifiers to buff and debuff duration or expiry rate do not apply. Hostile totems can be turned into allies using Conversion Trap. Auras from the totem will affect the player and a Shockwave Totem will attack the player's enemies. Temporary allies: Monsters converted by Conversion Trap are not considered minions and do not scale with minion-specific stats or minion support gems. In PvP content, Conversion Trap can not affect players; however, their minions can be converted.[1] Warriors found in the Trial of the Ancestors cannot be converted. Conversion Trap can drop anywhere. Conversion Trap can be created from the following recipes: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests: The following helmet enchantments affect Conversion Trap. Note that helmet enchantments are no longer obtainable since version 3.23.0 and can only be obtained in permanent leagues as already enchanted items from before this patch.
