Creeping Frost is a projectile cold spell that launches a frozen skull at a targeted area. The projectile will explode when it reaches the targeted area, or if it comes into contact with an enemy. This explosion causes initial damage and creates a Chilling Area that slows and deals cold damage over time to any enemies that enter it. This chilling area will move in the direction of nearby enemies. Creeping Frost's chilling area is not considered Chilled Ground. Enemies affected by Creeping Frost's chilling area counts as being Chilled by you. Creeping Frost can drop anywhere. Cruelty Support is a support gem. Hits from active skills supported by this gem grant the Cruelty buff. Per its reminder text, Cruelty makes all Skills Supported by Cruelty Support deal up to 40% more Damage over Time, based on the amount of Damage in the Hit which grants it. The buff affects all skills supported by any Cruelty Support. Damaging ailments inflicted by a hit that grants Cruelty are not affected by that instance of Cruelty, because damage calculation occurs before on-hit buffs are gained. Proxies cannot gain or grant the player Cruelty. Damage over time from a proxy's skill can benefit from Cruelty Support if the player obtains a Cruelty buff from a different skill that deals damage directly.[1] (This is likely not an option for totems due to Ancestral Bond.) Minion skills that also deal damage directly (e.g. Dominating BlowDominating BlowAttack, Minion, Duration, Melee, StrikeLevel: (1-20)Cost: (7-10) ManaAttack Damage: (249-458)% of baseEffectiveness of Added Damage: (249-458)%Requires Level 28Attacks enemies with a melee strike, applying a debuff for a short duration. Right click to remove from a socket.) can be supported by Cruelty, but minions cannot gain the Cruelty buff, nor can they benefit from a buff on the player. Culling Strike is a support gem. If an enemy is left with 10% life or less after getting hit by a skill supported by Culling Strike, they will be instantly slain. Culling strike affects enemies regardless of their rarity, but does not work on enemies that have a scripted death, such as Uber Elder in its final phase,[1] beasts captured by Einhar, or Catarina, Master of Undeath. Damage over time: because damage over time does not hit, it cannot cull. Culling Strike Support can drop anywhere. Damage on Full Life is a support gem that grants more damage made with the supported attacks, but only when the player (or minion) is on full life. Being even one life below the maximum will nullify the effect, unless the player uses something like Life Mastery to lower the threshold for "full life". The gem only improves the supported skill's damage if the player is on full life. Blood Magic: If the supported skill uses Blood Magic, then using the skill will make the player no longer at full life. However, if the player can recover to full life before the attack skill hits an enemy, then the more Damage will still apply. Decay Support is a support gem that makes hits from supported skills inflict Decay, a chaos damage over time debuff. Decay is a chaos damage over time debuff. It is not affected by modifiers to skill effect duration[1] and does not add a duration to supported skills. Since Decay is a debuff, only one instance will ever apply at a time - it does not stack. The highest damage active instance of the debuff will apply. Reapplying the debuff will refresh the duration. Decay damage is considered damage from the supported skill, and is affected by all relevant modifiers of that skill, including global stats from the player, stats from support gems, and stats inherent to the active skill. Defiance Banner is a banner aura skill. After gaining Valour from melee combat, it can be activated, consuming all Valour and placing a banner that buffs the user and allies within an area with increased movement speed, additional chance to suppress spell damage, and a flat subtraction to damage taken from suppressed spell hits. The effect of the aura is multiplied based on the amount of Valour consumed. When the banner is placed with 50 Valour, the buff provides 48% increased Movement Speed to You and Allies, +48% chance to Suppress Spell Damage to You and Allies, and -72 Damage taken of each Damage Type from Suppressed Hits to You and Allies. Defiance Banner can drop anywhere. There is currently no way to clear a spectre bank; it can only be ignored by removing the Raise Spectre gem. Spectral Corpses will only be created if at least one monster is in your spectre bank. Before 10 or more different monsters are saved in the spectre bank, each additional spectre saved dilutes the chance for the Spectral Corpse to be a specific spectre. After 10 or more spectres are saved, the chance does not get further diluted, and the oldest monster saved will be removed from the spectre bank. To share spectres between players, the players should join the same hideout area. After doing so, either player will be able to spawn spectral corpses of other players in the area.

Destructive Link is a Link skill that targets an allied player to apply a buff which links you to them for a duration. While linked, they use your critical strike chance for main hand hits. If the target dies while linked, you will also die. This skill cannot be used by Totems, Traps, or Mines. This skill replaces the linked target's main hand critical strike chance with yours; this uses the value in the player's character sheet which is affected by modifiers to critical strike chance, not just the base critical strike chance of the weapon. Detonate Mines is a skill gem that performs the same function as the gem-less detonate skill that is automatically made available when a player has used a mine. Unlike detonating mines using the hotkey, the Detonate Mines skill gem can take advantage of mechanics afforded by being linked to support gems. Detonate Mines can drop anywhere. Devouring Totem summons a totem that can consume nearby corpses. Each corpse consumed will leech life and mana to the player. It will consume corpses when the player is missing either life or mana. Totem range is 60. The life and mana leech granted by Devouring Totem can be scaled by increases or reductions to life and mana leech rate as well as life and mana recovery rate. Can be combined with keystones such as Vaal Pact or Ghost Reaver. Elemental Weakness is one of the curses that can be rolled on tier 6+ maps and vaal side areas (known as "secret_area" in spawn weight table below). The curse affects the entire area and cannot be removed. The debuff applied is not a skill, but has values equivalent to a curse from a level 1 skill gem. Its effect is not modified by increased effect of Modifiers on your (Non-Unique) Maps. It can be mitigated with the upgraded Soul of Yugul or other item modifiers that offer reduced/less effect of curses on you. The following map mods can only be find in legacy map item in permanent leagues: This was a restartless deploy of the patch so you will need to restart your client to receive the client changes, specifically the Map Curse modifier change requires a client restart to visually update descriptions. All curse skills have been reworked and are now divided into two categories: Hexes and Marks.

Empower is a support gem that increases the gem level of supported active skill gems. Empower is a drop-only gem that doesn't have any effect at level one and has a level cap of 3. Empower only affects skill gems, meaning skills granted from items can't be supported by it. Empower Support can drop anywhere. Enhance is a support gem that increases the quality of supported active skill gems. Enhance is a drop-only gem that doesn't have any effect at level one and has a level cap of 3. The required experience to reach level 3 is considerably greater than normal gems. Its level cap can be exceeded the same way as other gems. Enhance only affects skill gems, meaning skills granted from items can't be supported by it. Enhance Support can drop anywhere. Enhance Support can be created from the following recipes: Enhance is part of a cycle of three support gems affecting the supported skill gem's stats instead of their effects. The other two are:

Enlighten is a support gem that has no modifiers, and its sole function is having a cost and reservation multiplier less than 100%. Enlighten is primarily used to decrease the amount of reservation of linked skills. This effect is multiplicative with the effects of x% Increased Reservation Efficiency modifiers and the Socketed Skill Gems get a 90% Cost & Reservation Multiplier corrupted implicit modifier. Ensnaring Arrow is a bow attack skill which fires an arrow that tethers to the ground behind the enemy it hits, debuffing it with Snared. The ensnared enemy has less movement speed per snare (up to 3), takes increased hit damage from projectile attacks. Snares are removed when the enemy moves out of the arrow's area of effect. Split/Pierce/Fork/Chain/Return: Ensnaring Arrow cannot ensnare an enemy if the arrow continues from the enemy due to any projectile behaviours. Arrows that pierce or fork will never ensnare a target. Returning arrows can ensnare an enemy if the arrow collides and stops at that enemy. Arrows that have remaining chains can ensnare an enemy if there are no other eligible enemies to chain to. Ensnaring Arrow can drop anywhere. Eternal Blessing Support is a support gem that makes Aura Skills lose their reservations and become a Blessing Skill. You will only be able to benefit from one Blessing at a time and while under the effect of a Supported Skill, all Non-Blessing Skills which reserve mana are disabled. This support gem lets you use a single aura without reserving mana for it, but it disables reserving mana for any other skill. Ethereal Knives (often referred to as EK) is a spell that throws multiple knives in an arc in front of the caster that deal physical damage. Multiple knives cannot hit the same target. The angle of the spell's arc is fixed and does not depend on where the cursor is, unlike other projectile skills. Despite the fact that it does physical damage, Ethereal Knives is a spell and not an attack. It does not utilize weapon damage in any way. Ethereal Knives can drop anywhere. This article describes new Path of Exile content released in version 3.25.0. Information may be missing or incorrect. Please expand this article so that it provides complete and accurate information. Eviscerate is a retaliation melee attack skill that unleashes two arcing waves of force in front of the user that applies bleeding. This skill requires a shield and a sword or axe to use. This skill becomes usable after blocking a hit. Eviscerate fires two simultaneous rectangular damaging areas in a V shape in front of you. Because of the angle of the attack and the shape of the damaging areas, the attack may miss name-locked targets if they are far enough away from the user in the area between the damaging areas. However, close targets can be hit twice, once by each damaging area. Eviscerate can drop anywhere. Explosive Arrow is a bow attack skill that fires an arrow which sticks to terrain or enemies and explodes after a duration, dealing damage in an area. Any additional arrows stuck to an enemy will add their damage to the explosion, while also granting more damage with hits, damaging ailments, and area of effect. Explosive Arrow has two separate damaging mechanics: arrow collisions and exploding arrows.[1] Collision: Attacking fires a regular arrow, colliding with enemies and dealing damage with no special mechanics. Instead of disappearing, arrows remain stuck to terrain or enemies for a duration. Sticking additional arrows in an enemy does not affect the duration of other arrows. Explosion: When the duration of an arrow expires, the maximum number of stuck arrows is reached, or a target dies, all arrows on a target will explode for area projectile damage. Each arrow calculates its own damage, individually, including critical strike chance and chance to inflict damaging ailments. Hit damage and ailment dps from each arrow are then combined and applied as a single hit and debuff.[2] If any contributing arrow deals a critical strike, the combined hit counts as a critical strike for relevant effects, though without further modifying damage.[3] The Explosion deals 50% less Base Damage stat only modifies base damage, meaning flat damage contributed by local values on your bow.[4] Projectile Mechanics: Arrows cannot stick in enemies if they continue due to Chain, Pierce, Fork, Split or Return. Explosive Trap is a spell that throws a trap that creates multiple explosions when triggered. It deals physical damage that's converted to fire damage. The base radius of the large explosion is 1.2m, and the base radius of the small explosions is 0.7m, with the default size having a radius of 1.0m. Both of these radii are increased by the +x metres to radius gained from gem levels and by modifiers to Area of Effect. The chance that a small explosion will hit a targeted enemy can be calculated as ( r s m a l l + r e n e m y − 0.1 m ) 2 / ( r l a r g e ) 2 \color [rgb]{0.6392156862745098,0.5529411764705883,0.42745098039215684}(r_{small}+r_{enemy}-0.1m)^{2}/(r_{large})^{2} . Increases to radius improve the overlap chance of small explosions on the targeted enemy by increasing the ratio of the small radius to the large radius, while increased area of effect may either increase or decrease the overlap chance, as different breakpoints in the calculation of the large and small radius are reached.[1] Explosive Trap can drop anywhere. Eye of Winter is a cold spell that fires a projectile that deals no damage but that constantly releases shard projectiles in a spiral over its lifetime, and then on dissipation or collision with terrain explodes in an additional spiral of shard projectiles. The spell will fire 31 shards over its lifetime, and then explode for an additional 8 (+1 per 10 quality) shards. Additional Projectiles: Sources of additional projectiles do not increase the number of primary eye projectiles fired through casting this spell. These behaviors do apply to the secondary shard projectiles, however. Right click to remove from a socket., both the primary and secondary projectiles will return in the direction of the player's current position. Projectiles that dissipate before reaching their maximum range will not return however, thus this will usually only occur when the projectiles hit an obstacle, such as walls or elevated terrain. Projectile Speed: Modifiers to projectile speed affect both types of projectiles from this skill- the eye and the secondary shard projectiles. If projectile speed is increased, for example, the eye projectile travels further than it normally would, as do the shard projectiles, which would travel further before they dissipate. This can effectively increase the coverage area of this skill. Bear in mind, however, that the faster the eye projectile, the larger the gap formed between shard projectiles unleashed in the spiral; this may cause single targets close to the caster to take less damage than if the eye projectile travels slower. Spiral of Shard Projectiles: This skill fires an "eye" projectile which fires out secondary "shard" projectiles as it travels. These shards are released constantly as the eye travels, and if a target is directly in the center of the eye, the multiple shards can hit that target. This behavior also applies to the final spiral that is triggered upon the eye projectile reaching the end of its lifetime (through reaching its maximum distance or colliding with terrain). Though it may look like an explosion, it is indeed a very fast sequential spiral, meaning that with careful positioning by the player, a single target may be hit by all projectiles in this last spiral, effectively "shotgunning" this target. Traps and Mines: This skill can be turned into traps or mines with the appropriate support gems. Eye of Winter has 2 variants: Eye of Winter can drop anywhere.

Faster Casting is a support gem that increases the cast speed of linked spells. When linked to a minion skill, Faster Casting increases both the cast speed of the summoning spell, and the speed with which summoned minions cast their own spells. Faster Casting also affects the speed with which totems, traps or mines cast spells, but not the speed of placing totems or laying traps or mines. Trap and mine laying speed is instead affected by Trap and Mine Laying Speed, and totem placement speed by Totem Placement Speed. Faster Casting Support can drop anywhere. This article describes historical game content. Originally part of the prophecy system, fated unique items were improved versions of other unique items. Various unique items could be upgraded to their fated forms by fulfilling the prophecy that involved slaying a specific unique monster while holding that item. Once the prophecy was fulfilled, the item would be given a new name and additional stats. Fated unique items started to be phased out in version 3.17.0 and were fully removed in version 3.19.0. Fated unique items were originally part of the prophecy system, first introduced in Prophecy league. A number of prophecies could be fulfilled by defeating a specific unique monster while holding a specific unique item. As a result of fulfilling the prophecy, the unique item would be transformed into its fated form, giving it additional stats, a new name and new flavor text. One such prophecy, From The VoidFrom The VoidThe iron heart, burned in the blackness of the void that lies beyond sight, rots all it touches.You will defeat Bameth while holding Blackheart.Right-click to add this prophecy to your character., required the character to kill Bameth while holding BlackheartBlackheartIron RingAdds 1 to 4 Physical Damage to AttacksAdds (10-15) to (20-25) Chaos Damage to AttacksRegenerate (10-15) Life per second10% chance to Cause Monsters to FleeFear is highly infectious. in order to turn it into VoidheartVoidheartIron RingRequires Level 48Adds 1 to 4 Physical Damage to Attacks5% increased Global Physical DamageAdds (10-15) to (20-25) Chaos Damage to Attacks+(20-30) to maximum LifeRegenerate (10-15) Life per second10% chance to Cause Monsters to FleeMelee Attacks have (30-50)% chance to cause BleedingMelee Attacks have (20-40)% chance to Poison on HitNothing spreads fear faster than the unknown.. The first iteration of the upgrade process required the character to have the unique item equipped as the monster was killed in order to fulfill the prophecy. In version 3.1.0, this restriction was loosened; the player could either equip the item or simply place it in the character's inventory while defeating the monster. In all cases, the prophecy would remain unfulfilled if the unique item was corrupted, or it was an alternate art or foil variant. When a unique item was upgraded into its fated form, its name and flavor text would change, and it would gain (and sometimes lose) one or more modifiers, depending on the item. Apart from that, it would retain all of its original properties. Its appearance, quality value, item level, and base stats would stay the same. The number, color and link configuration of its sockets would remain unchanged, along with any gems placed into those sockets. Any modifiers that carried over to the fated version would keep the same values that they had originally. Before the removal of the prophecy system in version 3.17.0, the following prophecies could be fulfilled to transform a certain unique item into its fated form. Prophecies no longer exist in the game. With the removal of the prophecy system in version 3.17.0, Grinding Gear Games began to phase out fated unique items.

Before the removal of the prophecy system in version 3.17.0, the following prophecies could be fulfilled to transform a certain unique item into its fated form. Prophecies no longer exist in the game. With the removal of the prophecy system in version 3.17.0, Grinding Gear Games began to phase out fated unique items. Over half of them became unobtainable outside of trading with other players in permanent leagues. At the same time, some unique items were reworked to be equivalent or similar to their old fated forms. The fated unique items that remained during the phasing out period formed a special pool of drop-restricted unique items. Map bosses were given a small chance to drop a random fated unique item, already identified, in addition to their other loot drops. Firestorm is a spell that rains numerous fiery bolts in an area, each bolt dealing area of effect fire damage. Area of Effect: Increased AoE will increase both the area in which the fireballs randomly fall and also the radius of the individual fireball damage. Full spell damage is done at any point within the AoE of a fireball. However, increasing the size of the spell area means that each monster within the spell area is within fewer individual fireball bursts[1]; thus, less spell damage is dealt to any single enemy as area increases. For this reason increasing the AoE of Firestorm paradoxically decreases the average damage dealt to a single target. Duration: Increasing duration with either supports or passives will increase the total number of fireballs that fall before the spell ends. Damage Effectiveness: Damage from secondary sources like 'added damage' supports or heralds applies at only 80% of their listed value. Damage per Second: Due to the complexity of estimating actual DPS of the skill including all possible factors, ingame tooltip shows only average damage per hit of one fireball, with actual DPS of the skill being considerably higher. The closest currently available estimate can be obtained by using the damage calculator. Firestorm can drop anywhere. Flame Surge of Combusting is a spell that deals fire damage in a narrow area of effect in front of the caster. It has a chance to Ignite, which also leaves Burning Ground that deals damage proportional to the ignite damage. It is a transfigured version of Flame SurgeFlame SurgeSpell, AoE, Fire, DurationLevel: (1-20)Cost: (6-16) ManaCast Time: 0.50 secCritical Strike Chance: 6.00%Effectiveness of Added Damage: 190%AoE Radius: 30Requires Level 12Strikes enemies in front of you with a surge of flame. Burning enemies are dealt more damage. If you hit an ignited enemy, will create burning ground under them. Your damage modifiers don't apply to this burning ground.Base duration is 4.00 secondsDeals (26-832) to (40-1247) Fire Damage(50-88)% more Damage with Hits against Burning enemiesCannot Ignite+(0-9) to Area of Effect lengthHits on Ignited Enemies create Burning Ground, no more than once every 2 secondsBurning Ground deals 25% of Fire Damage per second of Ignite affecting Enemy Additional Effects From 1-20% Quality: +(1-20)% more Damage with Hits against Burning enemiesPlace into an item socket of the right colour to gain this skill. Right click to remove from a socket.. Unlike the original skill, this transfigured version can ignite, and create burning ground on ignite rather than when hitting an ignited enemy, with a higher percentage of the ignite's DPS. It also costs more mana and has a slower cast time, but has more damage and damage effectiveness. It no longer has a multiplier for hits against burning enemies. Gem quality increases the burning ground damage scaling instead. Burning Ground scaling: modifiers to burning damage, fire damage, etc. all apply to the initial ignite inflicted by this skill. To prevent double-dipping, these do not also affect the burning ground created by this skill. However, due to the specific base damage source of the ground effect—raw DPS of the ignite—it can be increased at a greater degree than the total damage of the ignite. This can be accomplished through the use of "faster" modifiers to ignites, most notably Sadism Support which, while reducing total ignite damage, greatly increases actual second-to-second DPS of the ignite and burning ground alike. As an independent skill effect, the burning ground is not tied to the duration of the ignite. Absent any skill effect duration modifiers, the burning ground will always last 4 seconds. Flame Surge of Combusting has restrictions on where or how it can drop. This item is a transfigured gem. It can be obtained through the use of the Divine Font in the Lord's Labyrinth. Flamewood Support is a support gem that causes totems to trigger Avenging Flame when hit by an enemy, which fires a mortar into the air, dealing fire damage in an area around the target that hit it. Avenging Flame is a triggered fire projectile spell that fires a projectile into the air that falls around the enemy that hit the totem, dealing damage in an area. Flesh and Stone is an aura skill that activates Blood and Sand Stance. In Blood Stance (Flesh), the aura debuffs nearby enemies to take more physical damage from hits. In Sand Stance (Stone), the user is buffed to take less hit damage from entities inside the aura. Both effects are stronger the closer enemies are to the user. Activating the skill while it's toggled on will alternate between stances. Certain skills also behave differently based on the stance you are currently in. Nearby: Enemies within 1.5 metres of the user receive the full effect, which scales linearly down to 0 at the edge of the area. Increasing the aura's radius only affects the edge of the area and does not affect the 1.5 metre range for maximum effect. Increasing the aura radius does affect the interpolation between the two circles, however.[1] Aura effect: Aura effect will scale the Nearby Enemies take up to 10% more Physical Damage from Hits while in Blood Stance stat, but not Take up to 10% less Damage from Nearby Enemies while in Sand Stance; the less Damage taken stat is an effect of the buff, not the aura. Enemies: Despite specifying enemies, the Stone buff is able to reduce damage taken from nearby environmental objects that hit, such as some Labyrinth traps.[2] Additionally, it mitigates hits against yourself (with maximum effectiveness). Flesh Offering is an offering spell that consumes one or more corpses, temporarily granting the player's minions swiftness. The skill consumes a corpse and up to 4 additional corpses around it. Each additional corpse extends the base duration of the skill by 1 second, making the maximum achievable base duration 9 seconds. Each player may only have one Offering active at any time. Casting an Offering skill while one is already active will cancel the older one. Flesh Offering can drop anywhere. Flesh Offering can be created from the following recipes: This item is given as a quest reward for the following quests: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests: The following helmet enchantments affect Flesh Offering. Note that helmet enchantments are no longer obtainable since version 3.23.0 and can only be obtained in permanent leagues as already enchanted items from before this patch. The following unique items are related to Flesh Offering:

Flicker Strike is a melee attack skill that teleports the character to a nearby enemy and strikes it with their weapon and grants increased movement speed for a short time. If no specific monster is chosen, one is picked at random. The skill has a cooldown that can be bypassed by expending a Frenzy Charge and has a chance to generate a Frenzy Charge when used. The character is considered to be stationary while flickering for the purpose of receiving buffs such as the Inexorable notable passive skill, and that they have moved each time they flickered. For this reason the character never benefits from "while moving" buffs, and the timers for scaling stationary buffs are continuously reset.[1] Minimum Frenzy Charges cannot be consumed to bypass the cooldown. Dual Wielding while using Flicker Strike will cause the player to alternate weapons each attack. Flicker Strike can target an enemy within a distance of 4 meters by default. This is unaffected by modifiers to area of effect. Modifiers to Melee Strike Range have no special interaction with teleports: you will neither "land" farther from the target when you flicker, nor will you be able to initiate an attack from farther away. Flicker Strike can drop anywhere. Flicker Strike can be created from the following recipes: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests: The following helmet enchantments affect Flicker Strike. Note that helmet enchantments are no longer obtainable since version 3.23.0 and can only be obtained in permanent leagues as already enchanted items from before this patch. Projectiles: By default, Forbidden Rite fires a projectile near your cursor, as well as additional projectiles for each enemy within range. This means that on single target, two projectiles will hit the enemy. Sources of additional projectiles will only add projectiles to the initial cursor-targeted projectile, and not the extra projectiles fired towards nearby enemies. The projectiles appear to have an expanding ring-based hit distribution, and it is recommended not to get more than +4 additional projectiles from various sources due to the tendency for projectiles to miss on smaller single targets. The projectiles appear to have a homing behaviour and will bend towards targeted enemies. The projectile is ground targeted and does not benefit from Chain, Fork, Split, Pierce or any projectile behaviour modifiers. However, Projectile Speed will greatly reduce the time between casting the skill and the impact of the projectile, enhancing the skill performance against moving enemies.

Frenzy is a ranged attack that grants frenzy charges on hit and also gains large bonuses from them. It requires a bow or wand. More Attack Damage per Frenzy Charge: Frenzy deals more hit damage based on the player's current charges. Damage is calculated before on-hit effects, including its own charge gain. Like most skills, Frenzy is limited in charge gain. Per attack or trigger, Frenzy can only gain 1 Frenzy charge from hits, regardless of multiple projectiles, mechanics like chain, or repeats from e.g. Fatal Flourish. Frenzy can drop anywhere. Frost Shield is a spell that creates a chilling area around the caster for a duration. The area drains your energy shield when initially cast, and uses the absorbed energy shield to redirect a percentage of the damage the user takes to itself while the user is within it. The user also gains increased spell critical strike chance while within the field. Chilling Area: Enemies that are inside the chilling area become chilled by the player. Modifiers to chill and cold/non-damaging ailments apply, including from support gems. It can apply chilled by you stats, enable if you have chilled recently stats, and cannot chill when the player or skill cannot chill. Energy Shield Recharge: Recharge is disabled while the effect is draining energy shield. Despite not being damage, the drain also interrupts ES recharge, which Wicked Ward may prevent.[1] Frost Shield can drop anywhere. Greater Multiple Projectiles (often referred to as GMP) is a support gem that causes any linked projectile skills to fire four more projectiles than they otherwise would. For instance, SparkSparkSpell, Projectile, Duration, LightningLevel: (1-20)Cost: (5-21) ManaCast Time: 0.65 secCritical Strike Chance: 6.00%Effectiveness of Added Damage: 190%Projectile Speed: 420Launches unpredictable sparks that move randomly until they hit an enemy or expire.Deals (1-104) to (28-1983) Lightning DamageBase duration is 2.00 secondsFires (4-8) Projectiles Additional Effects From 1-20% Quality: Fires +(0.1-2) ProjectilesPlace into an item socket of the right colour to gain this skill. The projectiles fan out in an arc, facing the direction that the skill is aimed. The spread of the arc is controlled by the positioning the mouse cursor. Positioning the cursor close to the character will result in a wide arc, while positioning it at the edges of the screen will result in a narrow arc. Ailments: The "less projectile damage" on the gem doesn't decrease the damage of ailments such as poison, bleed and ignite, so gmp can be used safely to increase the number of targets hit. This can be especially useful with poison and skills that hit the same enemy multiple times, like Barrage and Tornado Shot, as they will stack multiple poisons without diminishing their strength. Guardian's Blessing Support is a support gem that makes an aura skill lose its reservation and become a Blessing Skill. You will only be able to benefit from one Blessing at a time. The aura can only be used while you have a supported minion, which takes a percentage of their maximum life as physical damage over time. Blessing: Blessing skills are limited to 1 aura at a time and cannot be used with other blessing skills. The blessing must be activated by casting it while the linked minion is alive. The aura is cast on the character, like other auras. If the minion dies or expires, Guardian's Blessing is turned off and must be re-activated. Hextouch Support is a support gem that causes a linked skill to apply linked hex(es) on hit. Hexes linked to Hextouch cannot be cast directly. Another linked skill that can hit enemies is required to enable the ability to curse enemies. Hexes are applied after the first hit; the first hit will not be affected by debuffs from the applied hex. Skills that hit multiple times will benefit from the hex after the first hit. Damage over time effects applied by a hexing hit (for example, Decay or ignite) will benefit from the hex. Hexes applied by supported skills no longer have an area of effect, as they only affect enemies hit with the skill. Minions, totems, mines, and traps cannot apply hexes linked to Hextouch Support. As Hextouch does not actually trigger the linked hex and instead applies the equivalent hex to an enemy, the player does not spend mana or other resources when the hex is applied. Hextouch is only considered a trigger for the linked hex and not the skill which is applying it (see Trigger). This means supporting a triggered skill (e.g. The Hidden BladeThe Hidden BladeAmbusherDaggerPhysical Damage: (62.7-68.4) to (244.2-266.4)Critical Strike Chance: 7.80%Attacks per Second: 1.50Weapon Range: 1.0 metresRequires Level 60, 113 Dex, 113 Int30% increased Global Critical Strike ChanceTrigger Level 20 Unseen Strike every 0.5 seconds while Phasing+(20-40) to Dexterity(230-260)% increased Physical Damage30% reduced Attack Speed while PhasingThe shadow warrior moves like the wind;his strikes land long after he is gone.'s Unseen Strike) does not disable that skill by giving it two triggers. Increased Critical Strikes Support is a support gem. Any skills linked to this gem will have an increased chance of scoring a critical strike. Increased Critical Strikes Support grants both increased percentage chance and added base critical strike chance, which stacks additively with other increased Critical Strike Chance modifiers. The supported skill must have the ability to score a critical strike for this gem to have any effect. For example, linking this gem to a curse will have no effect. Linking Increased Critical Strikes to a skill that creates a minion or remote (totem, trap, mine) will affect its chance to crit if it can already crit (curses, auras and the like being exempt). Increased Critical Strikes Support can drop anywhere. Inspiration Support is a support gem that lessens the mana cost of linked skills. When the supported skill is used, it grants an Inspiration Charge, which grants more elemental damage and increased critical strike chance to linked skills. You lose all Inspiration Charges after you spend a certain amount of mana. The mod of this gem: Supported Skills have #% less Mana Cost does not affect mana reservation. Supported skills grant you a Inspiration Charge when you spend mana with them, up to 5 charges. These charges last for 10 seconds. If you haven't generated a charge within those 10 seconds, you will lose all Inspiration Charges. Eldritch Battery: If used, the player will not gain inspiration charges until the energy shield pool is depleted and the mana (underneath the protective energy shield front-end/layer) is being spent.[1] This creates a mana counter for all skills linked with Inspiration Support, up to the respective cap. As soon as a skill is used that puts the total mana spent above the threshold, the mana counter is reset to 0 and all Inspiration Charges are removed. Hence lower mana costs result in better usage of Inspiration Charges. For example, if it takes 100 mana to cast a skill, the first 5 casts will average at 50% of the gem's potential and then the next 3 casts will be at 100% potential, while a mana cost of 1 will result in 795 casts at maximum efficiency after the first 5 initial casts. The less mana cost of skills is additive with other sources of less mana costs. The Inspiration Charges grants more elemental damage and increased critical strike chance per Charge to linked skill gems. Inspiration Charges are shared between all skills linked with Inspiration Support. Intensify Support is a support gem which causes the supported spell to have an increased area of effect. Consecutive casts will have less area of effect and deal more area damage per intensity stack. Gaining/Losing Stacks Tips Intensify Support can drop anywhere. Iron Grip is a support gem that grants the supported skill the effects of the Iron Grip keystone, as well as increased projectile damage. This gem causes strength's physical damage bonus to also apply to projectile attacks made with the supported skills. This causes the supported skill to gain 1% increased physical projectile attack per 5 strength. Since this gem applies the same effect as the Iron Grip keystone passive, these effects do not stack. Taking the keystone in addition to using this gem will impart no additional benefits. Iron Grip Support can drop anywhere. Iron Grip Support can be created from the following recipes: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests:

Iron Will is a support gem that causes the supported skill to gain the effects of the Iron Will keystone, as well as increased spell damage. This gem causes strength's physical damage bonus to also apply to spell damage dealt with the supported skills. This causes the supported skill to gain 1% increased spell damage per 5 strength. Note that this applies to all spell damage, not just physical. Since this gem applies the same effect as the Iron Will keystone passive, these effects do not stack. Taking the keystone in addition to using this gem will impart no additional benefits. Iron Will Support can drop anywhere. Iron Will Support can be created from the following recipes: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests:

Item Quantity is a support gem. It increases the quantity of items dropped by monsters killed by the supported skill. This skill gem no longer drops in the game, and can only be obtained by trading for existing ones in the permanent leagues.[1] However, it can be found as a foil in the Legacy league through Reliquary Key.[citation needed] See also: Item Rarity SupportItem Rarity SupportSupportIcon: RLevel: (1-20)Requires Level 31Supports any skill that can kill enemies.(40-59)% increased Rarity of Items Dropped by Enemies Slain from Supported Skills Additional Effects From 1-20% Quality: (0.5-10)% increased Rarity of Items Dropped by Enemies Slain from Supported SkillsThis is a Support Gem. It does not grant a bonus to your character, but to skills in sockets connected to it. Place into an item socket connected to a socket containing the Skill Gem you wish to augment. Right click to remove from a socket. Damage over time: Increased item quantity from this gem applies also to enemies killed by damage over time effects.[2] Containers: The modifier from this gem does not apply to the quantity of items dropped by opening chests, strongboxes, or other containers. Mechanics that have a defined drop count are also unaffected. For example, the number of abyss jewel drops from Abyssal Troves, essences from imprisoned monster, Blight reward chests, etc, are not affected. Boss drop: While this will affect the quantity of items drops from a map boss, it will not affect the boss specific drop quantity. Fragments from guardians and conquerors, boss specific uniques and boss specific currencies are not affected by item quantity. Maps: This gem does not affect the number of maps that drop. When linked with a skill that creates a minion, trap, mine, or totem, the item quantity modifier will apply to kills made by the minion/trap/mine/totem. This includes deaths caused by Minion Instability explosions. Item Quantity Support is drop disabled.

Life Gain on Hit is a support gem. For every hit made using an attack supported by this gem, you will gain the listed amount of life instantly. The life gain is applied for every hit, not every attack - an arrow that pierces three enemies will cause the attacker to gain life for each of the three enemies that is hit. The effect of this gem will stack with other sources of life gain on hit. Mana Leech is a support gem. Attack Skills supported by this gem will leech mana back to the player, based on how much damage they deal. Unlike most sources of mana leech that only count physical damage, the leech from this gem considers all attack damage types when determining how much mana the attacker will gain. However, it will not work on damage over time effects. Mana Leech Support can drop anywhere. Manaforged Arrows is a support gem that triggers a linked bow attack skill when the player spends enough mana on other bow attacks. Supported Skills Trigger once total Mana Spent on other Bow Attacks exceeds 300% of their Mana Cost: tracks cumulative mana spent on all bow attack skills, including ballista totem skills, traps, and mines that use bow skills. "Their" refers to "Supported Skills", not "other Bow Attacks". That is, the threshold is 300% of the mana cost of each supported skill, not 300% of the mana cost of the other bow attacks. Example: Tornado Shot is linked to Manaforged Arrows Support and costs 14 mana. Those 14 mana times 300% are 42 mana, which is the threshold. The other bow skill you are using is barrage (not supported by manaforged arrows support) and costs 6 mana. After attacking for the 7th time (7*6=42) you have reached the threshold and Tornado Shot will trigger. Meat Shield Support is a support gem for minion skills. It changes the minions' behaviour to be defensive, causing them to stay close to their owner and prioritise attacking close enemies by lowering their aggro radius. It also causes the supported minions to take less damage, grants increased movement speed, a chance to taunt on hit, and grants them more damage against enemies near you. Minions are Defensive: If a minion is both Aggressive and Defensive, the effects will cancel each other out. Melee Splash Support is a support gem that can be linked with a melee strike skill gem to add a splash effect to the attack, dealing damage around each enemy struck by it. Melee Splash only supports strike skills and has no interaction with other types of skills like slam skills. It causes the skill to deal damage around the strike target in a greater area than strike skill's default splashing behaviour. The splash damage is considered area melee damage and is not considered as part of the strike itself. The splash is affected by modifiers to area of effect and area damage, but will not affect the strike's damage if it was not originally dealing area damage.[1] The area of effect created by Melee Splash has a base radius of 14 units.[2] Splash can apply on-hit effects; for example, a hit that would knockback the target would also knockback enemies hit by the splash damage. Mirage Archer is a support gem that causes linked bow skills to summon a ghostly archer. When the player hits an enemy with the supported skill, a temporary Mirage Archer is summoned above the player which uses that skill. The Mirage Archer is a distinct entity, and as such, the following apply: Like a Totem, the mirage archer uses your skill and deals your damage, so most effects that apply to nearby allies will have no effect on it. Also like a totem, the archer has its own Action speed and its attack rate is not affected by Chill or Freeze inflicted on the player. Equipping a level 20 Mirage Archer with 0% quality translates to 27.6% more damage: Mirage Archer Support can drop anywhere. Momentum Support is a support gem. When you use the supported attack skill, it grants a stack of Momentum, granting increased attack speed per stack. Power Charge On Critical Support is a support gem that gives supported skills a chance of granting the player a power charge when they deal a critical strike, as well as more damage per power charge. Although each critical strike has an independent chance to grant a charge, most skills are limited to gaining 1 charge per attack or cast, including repeats.[1] Some skills bypass this limitation, see charge gain. Predator Support is a support gem for minion skills which grants the supported minions more damage. The gem also grants the player the Signal Prey skill, which can be targeted on an enemy to cause minions supported by Predator Support to focus attacking the target and gain more damage with hits and ailments against it. Signal Prey will temporarily override any Aggressive or Defensive minion behaviour during the effect. Predator Support can drop anywhere. Prismatic Burst Support is a support gem that causes the supported attack skill to release a Prismatic Burst on hit, dealing spell damage of a random chosen element in an area around the enemy. The player's strength, dexterity, and intelligence values determine the likelihood to pick fire, cold, and lightning damage respectively. Restrictions: Supports attacks, causing them to trigger the Prismatic Burst spell. Cannot support triggered attacks or attacks used by things other than you. Cannot modify the skills of minions. Prismatic Burst triggers at the location where the enemy was hit by an attack. Choosing elements: The % chance for Prismatic Burst to choose each specific element is visible in the tooltip for the skill. Conversion: Due to the Deals 100% less Damage of each unchosen Damage Type modifier, converting the skill's damage (such as with Avatar of Fire) will prevent unchosen damage types from adding any damage to the chosen damage type. Additionally, Prismatic Burst will be unable to ignite unless the chosen damage type of the hit is Fire. Additionally, Prismatic Burst cannot deal any Physical or Chaos damage, so modifiers that cause you to gain Elemental or non-Chaos Damage as Chaos Damage have no effect; this skill cannot poison enemies. Prismatic Burst Support can drop anywhere. Prismatic Burst Support can be created from the following recipes: Prismatic Burst Support is used in the following recipes: This item can be bought at the listed NPC vendors, after completing the following quests: In addition, the Large Chest in The Twilight Strand (Act 1) contains this gem, if the player selects Scion as the character. Replica unique items or replicas are engineered reproductions of existing unique items. They resemble the originals in design, but they come with a particular twist that makes them functionally different. Replicas can be obtained in the Curio Display in the final reward rooms of any Grand Heists. In almost all cases Replicas share the same base type as the original item. However, the modifiers on the items may differ significantly. All Replicas have names starting with Replica and symbol in front and at the back of their names. Although these symbols are not mutually exclusive with influenced items (which also have symbols), Replicas that do not have influence(s) by default cannot be obtained with influence. This article describes new Path of Exile content released in version 3.25.0. Information may be missing or incorrect. Please expand this article so that it provides complete and accurate information. Rupture is a support gem that supports Attack skills, causing them to inflict a stack of Rupture if they deal a critical strike that also applies bleeding. Rupture is a debuff that causes enemies to take more damage from bleeding, but also causes bleeding to expire more quickly. Per its reminder text, Up to 3 Ruptures can be inflicted on a target, lasting 3 seconds each. Rupture dynamically applies to all bleeding debuffs on the target, even those that are not applied by supported skills. Rupture's effect on expiration rate is effectively multiplicative with effects that cause bleeding to deal damage faster, such as Sadism SupportSadism SupportSupportIcon: XLevel: (1-20)Cost & Reservation Multiplier: 130%Requires Level 18Supports any skill that hits enemies.Damaging Ailments inflicted with Supported Skills deal damage (60-79)% faster80% less Duration of Ailments inflicted with Supported Skills Additional Effects From 1-20% Quality: Supported Skills deal (0.5-10)% increased Damage over TimeThis is a Support Gem. It does not grant a bonus to your character, but to skills in sockets connected to it. Place into an item socket connected to a socket containing the Skill Gem you wish to augment. Right click to remove from a socket..[1] The duration of Rupture is not affected by skill effect duration, as indicated by the lack of Duration gem tag. Rupture Support can drop anywhere. Right click to remove from a socket., Ruthless Blows will not occur from attacks 1-8, but from attacks 9-12. Using this idea, a Ruthless Blow may actually trigger by skill use, rather than skill attack. This means you will have to use the attack skill three times to benefit from a Ruthless Blow. The Ruthless Blow counter still counts whether or not you hit with a skill. For example: if you miss the hits from the first 2 uses of your supported attack, then Ruthless Blow will activate on your next (3rd) use whether it is a hit or not. This extends to Attack Cancelling, if you cancel the animation of your attack before it finishes, the Ruthless Blow counter still counts this and will activate on your third usage of the attack, whether you cancel it or not. It is possible to reset the Ruthless Blow counter to 0 by losing the active skill it supports, for example by resocketing it, or re-equipping the item it's socketed in.

The Ruthless Blow counter still counts whether or not you hit with a skill. For example: if you miss the hits from the first 2 uses of your supported attack, then Ruthless Blow will activate on your next (3rd) use whether it is a hit or not. This extends to Attack Cancelling, if you cancel the animation of your attack before it finishes, the Ruthless Blow counter still counts this and will activate on your third usage of the attack, whether you cancel it or not. It is possible to reset the Ruthless Blow counter to 0 by losing the active skill it supports, for example by resocketing it, or re-equipping the item it's socketed in. (Resocketing Ruthless Support itself does not reset the counter.) Tracking Blows: Keeping track of Ruthless Blows allows for them to be ready to use before a fight begins. However, life becoming reserved will interrupt life recharge if the unreserved maximum life becomes lower than your current life.[2] When life is paid or sacrificed to a skill's cost, your life total after you have paid the spell's cost is used to determine properties of the skill. This means that a character using a skill supported by Sacrifice can gain the benefit of Pain Attunement, or any other similar modifier, if the cost of using that skill brings them to Low Life. Proxy: Totems are the only proxy that can be supported with this gem. Totems will sacrifice their own life when casting and scales with totem life modifiers. Sadism Support is a support gem which causes damaging ailments you inflict to deal damage faster and have less duration. Sadism Support greatly modifies ailment duration. Damaging Ailments inflicted with Supported Skills deal damage #% faster is additive with other modifiers that cause ailments to deal damage faster or slower. To calculate the new ailment duration after supporting it with Sadism Support, use the following formula: Without any other sources of increased ailment duration, damaging ailments have the following modified base durations: Ignite and Bleeding gain more value from Sadism Support, as they cannot normally stack (and when they do, have a maximum stack amount), causing excessive stacks to be wasted. Modifying its duration to be significantly shorter allows greater efficiency of ailments. However, Sadism will also more likely than not result in large dps losses due to several factors, such as the fact "Damaging Ailments inflicted with Supported Skills deal damage faster" is additive to other sources (making it a poor support to begin with) and the fact it will very likely result in uptime losses, as you will need to continuously use your skills in order to inflict several bleeds or ignite per second. As soon as you are not able to do so, the slight dps increase is immediately lost by the fact you are not doing any damage while moving. Poison does not inherently have this issue as there is no maximum limit to poison stacks. However, several mechanics may benefit from having short-duration poisons so they expire before the next application, such as the Poison Mastery and stacking Low Tolerance which care about non-poisoned enemies, and Viper Strike of the MambaViper Strike of the MambaAttack, Duration, Melee, Strike, ChaosLevel: (1-20)Cost: (6-10) ManaAttack Damage: (155-442)% of baseEffectiveness of Added Damage: (155-442)%Hits enemies, converting some of your physical damage to chaos damage and inflicting poison which will be affected by modifiers to skill duration. Skill gem (known as Active Skill Gems in item filter), is an item class which grants skills to the player by placing them into an item socket. Similar to support gems, skill gems can gain experience and level up increasing both their Attribute(s) and character level requirement as well as the effect of the stats granted by the skill. Skill gems can be further augmented by placing appropriate support gems into a linked socket. Skill gems have gem tags which are used to categorize them, but note that gem tags are not intended to indicate whether a skill gem can be supported by other gems[1] or whether specific stats (or modifiers)[2] apply. While support gems are referred to as "support gems" by passive skills and item mods, such as Catarina's +# to Level of Socketed Support Gems, item filters refer to them as Support Skill Gems.

Skill Gems are a type of Gem in Path of Exile 2 (PoE 2). Skill Gems are the primary means by which you gain active abilities in the game. When you equip a Skill Gem, it grants you a specific Skill that you can use during combat. These skills can range from offensive abilities to defensive or utility skills. The skills provided by these Gems can be leveled up over time, increasing their effectiveness, such as enhancing their damage output, expanding their area of effect, or improving other aspects of the skill. Note: For a full table comparison of skills, see Skills In Path of Exile 2, Skill Gems are no longer attached to gear but are instead directly equipped by your character, with up to 9 active skills able to be used at once. Each Skill Gem can be enhanced by up to 5 Support Gems, which modify the skill's effects and behavior, allowing for a high degree of customization. To equip a Skill Gem, simply slot it into the leftmost section of the Skill Window. Once equipped, the skill will become available for use in your Skill Bar, located next to your Mana Orb at the bottom-right corner of the screen. From there, you can assign the skill to any slot by opening a pop-up menu, where you can choose from your currently equipped skills. Although all Skill Gems are accessible to all classes, certain skills are associated with specific weapon types, meaning that some abilities require particular equipment to use effectively. In Path of Exile 2, you can acquire Uncut Skill Gems and Uncut Support Gems, which drop as you defeat monsters and scale with the level of the area where they are obtained. These Gems provide greater flexibility, allowing you to choose the Skills you want as you progress through the game. Each Skill has specific level and attribute requirements that must be met before you can Engrave them into your character's setup. Some Skills also have a minimum level requirement. In Path of Exile 2, you can level up your Skills using Uncut Gems. These Gems drop with varying levels, meaning you could find a Level 5 Uncut Gem early in the campaign or a Level 19 Uncut Gem as you approach the endgame. If you don't need an Uncut Gem to Engrave a new Skill, you can use it to upgrade one of your existing Skills instead. In Path of Exile 2, Support Gems allow you to modify and enhance the behavior of your active Skill Gems, providing a way to tailor your abilities to suit your playstyle. When you find a Support Gem, right-clicking it opens a menu with a variety of recommended options that work well with your active Skill Gems. If a suggested Support Gem seems like a good fit, it’s likely to synergize well, but feel free to experiment and find what works best for you. You can also uncheck the "recommended" option to view a full list of Support Gems that can be paired with your active skills, offering even more possibilities for customization. Keep in mind that you can only equip one of each Support Gem, so choose wisely to maximize the effectiveness of your skills. Each active Skill Gem can have up to 5 Support Gems socketed into it, starting with 2 Sockets. You can increase this limit up to five using Jeweller's Orbs, which can be found throughout the game. These Support Gems can significantly alter how your Skills function, allowing you to create a build that’s uniquely suited to your playstyle. Spell Echo is a support gem that causes supported spells to repeat. A repeat is part of the original cast. It does not require a cost or a cooldown, normally has the same critical strike roll, and does not cause when you cast effects to occur a second time.[1] Spell Echo can only modify non-instant spells cast by a player or minion. It cannot support skills used by proxies or spells that trigger.[2] Repeats are not reflected in most ingame tooltip information: the time required for both the original cast and the repeat is two times the tooltip value. Summon Phantasm Support is a support gem that causes supported skills to summon a phantasm minion upon killing an enemy or hitting a rare or unique enemy. Linking Summon Phantasm Support to an active skill causes it to become a skill that summons minions. This does not add the minion gem tag to the skill gem.[1] It does enable supportability by gems compatible with phantasms—projectile spell-casting minions. Compatible stats may also affect non-minion aspects of the skill. The level of Summon Phantasm Support will always determine the level of the Phantasms.[2] Summoned phantasms have a base cast rate of 0.85, 40% Elemental Resistances, and 20% Chaos Resistance. Multiple skills can be supported by Summon Phantasm Support, but the total number of Phantasms is limited by the highest level support gem. This support gem can support Summon Phantasm, a related skill. Because the skill itself cannot hit or summon non-phantasm minions, it cannot trigger the support gem's effects, but it does add the Maximum # Summoned Phantasm stat to its default maximum phantasms. Due to a bug, Phantasms summoned from minion skills do not inherit minion bonuses from the skill that it's linked to.[3] Summon Phantasm Support is a support gem; it does not summon phantasms, the skill it supports does. If that skill has any minion bonuses, naturally or from other support gems, those bonuses can also apply to phantasms. For example: Note: Summon Phantasm Support is an old support that predates hybrid gems. Its coding is acknowledged as problematic[4] and the above interactions may not be functional. Ingame confirmation is recommended. Summon Phantasm Support can drop anywhere. Support Gems, also known as simply supports, are an item class of gems used to modify the behaviours of supported skill gems. Previously known as support skill gems, their name was changed to prevent confusion as supports are not actually skills. Instead of granting a specific skill like skill gems do, support gems modify any compatible skill gem linked to the support, modifying its behaviours as well as applying a mana cost multiplier. Please note that gem tags do not determine the supportability.[1] Multiple skill gems may be linked to a single support gem, in which case the support will modify all supported skills. Multiple support gems may be linked to a skill gem, in which case the skill gem will be modified by all of the supports. However, if two copies of a given support gem are linked to the same skill, only the higher level gem will apply. If a body armour contains two copies of a skill gem linked to different sets of support gems, two separate versions of the skill will be available, each with their own modifications. This may be desirable if for instance one version has been modified for single target damage, while another has been modified for area of effect damage. Suppport Gems are a type of Gem in Path of Exile 2 (PoE 2). Support Gems are designed to modify and enhance the effects of the Skill Gems they are linked to. Unlike Skill Gems, Support Gems do not have active abilities of their own; instead, they adjust the properties of a Skill Gem in various ways. These modifications allow players to tailor their skills to their preferred playstyle. Support Gems can also add additional effects such as increased damage, increased range, or other situational bonuses. Support Gems enhance Skill Gems in unique and impactful ways, offering greater customization for character builds. Over a hundred new Support Gems are being introduced, expanding strategic possibilities even further. Haemocrystals: introduce a fresh approach to bleed-focused builds, converting damage over time into devastating Vaal crystal explosions. Alignment: empowers Bow Attacks, rewarding precise positioning and tactical movement. Caltrops: scatters hazardous traps across the battlefield, hindering enemies' movement while spears tear through their ranks. Many more options cater to diverse playstyles, including Enormity, Unsteady Tempo, Profanity, Retaliate, Syzygy, and others yet to be unveiled. Path of Exile contains numerous unique items. Currently there are 1,353 released unique items, including maps and items with modifier variants. Many of these items were designed by players who bought a Diamond support pack during beta testing.

Transfigured skill gems are alternate versions of existing skill gems, denoted by having "of X" as a suffix that alters its function and balance. While they are technically the same item as their default versions, they can often drastically change the identity of the skill, even changing its gem tags and mechanics. The transfigured gem system, introduced in 3.23, replaced three older systems [1] that enhanced or altered the effects of skills: alternate quality gems, labyrinth helmet enchantments, and unique threshold jewels. It also took, or took inspiration, from prior league systems, such as 3.21's Crucible Passive Tree notables. Transfigured gems that have been corrupted to grant a Vaal skill will provide the transfigured base skill and Vaal skill. Vaal versions of skills do not have transfigurations.[2] Trigger cooldowns are shared between multiple skills of the same type, including any transfigurations. Skill microtransactions are compatible with their respective transfigured versions.[3] Within stash tabs, transfigured gems can be searched by searching for "transfigured" or any set of characters composing the word, including "trans" or "sfi". Using the Divine Font at the end of the Labyrinth allows players to obtain transfigured gems with varying degrees of randomness. There are 185 transfigured skill gems.

Trap Support is a support gem. When this gem is linked to a skill gem, it alters the skill so that instead of the player casting the skill directly, the player lays a trap. The trap is invisible to enemies, and the first enemy to enter the trap's trigger radius sets off the trap. That enemy is targeted by the linked skill, and the trap is destroyed. A unique item is an item with a specific name, unique artwork, and a predetermined list of modifiers. Unique items usually have the same implicit modifier as a normal item of the same type. Unique items are meant to be less powerful overall than high-level rare items, but offer unique gameplay and allow special character builds to be based around them.[citation needed] Currently there are 1,183 released unique items, including maps and items with modifier variants. For a timeline when each unique item was added, see the timeline of unique items. The following is a non-exhaustive list of ways that unique items can be obtained. Unique items can always be traded. Like all items, unique items can have legacy variants. This means for some uniques there exist better (or worse) versions that aren't dropping anymore in Standard leagues. The main source of legacy items are nerfs that affect future item drops, but leave the already existing items as they were. The only way to get these legacy items is from players who had them before they were changed. Rerolling the item's modifier values with a Divine OrbDivine OrbStack Size: 20Randomises the values of the random modifiers on an itemRight click this item then left click a magic, rare or unique item to apply it. may change a mod's values to match the current version of the unique item, but not for all of them. It will not add or remove modifiers that have been adjusted since then as well. During the Closed Beta phase of Path of Exile's development, supporters of the game that purchased the Diamond supporter pack were given the opportunity to collaborate on the design of a unique item.[4] For a period of time at the start of the Open Beta, Grinding Gear Games offered supporters a unique item design opportunity as a standalone purchase.[5] Once the Open Beta supporter packs were made available, Eternal and Ruler of Wraeclast supporters were likewise also given the opportunity to design a unique item.[6]

Many unique items can have several variants. These variants can be categorized into several categories, which also affect their generation and method of acquisition. Variants are distinctly different items from each other, so rerolling their modifier values with a Divine OrbDivine OrbStack Size: 20Randomises the values of the random modifiers on an itemRight click this item then left click a magic, rare or unique item to apply it. will never transform them into another variant. It is possible for an item to both have basetype variants and modifier variants. Basetype variants share the same name but have a different base item type. Doryani's Delusion, Precursor's Emblem, and Grand Spectrum are both basetype variants and modifier variants. Synthesised uniques and their fractured or regular (obtained via vendor recipe) versions are also considered basetype variants. Modifier variants generate with distinct combinations of modifiers and cannot change between or reroll into other variants. Lord of Steel and Impresence are distinct in having different art for each variant despite having the same basetype and name. They also have individual slots for each unique item art variant in the Unique Collection Tab; the regular Elder and Uber Uber Elder variants of each damage type variant of Impresence share the same slots, however. Pseudo-variants are sets of items which are distinct and different in name, but are typically treated as variants of the same item.
